text: A man in a CLOWN MASK holding a SMOKING SILENCED PISTOL e a shell casing.  This is DOPEY.  He turns to a second man HAPPY, also in clown mask, who steps forward with a CABLE LAUNCHER, aims at a lower roof across the street and FIRE cable across.  Dopey secures the line to an I-beam line-  CLAMP on- sends a KIT BAG out then steps OUT the window..
...into space.  The men SLIDE across the DIZZYING DROP... landing on the lower roof across the street.
A MAN on the corner, back to us, holding a CLOWN MASK.  A SUV pulls up.  The man gets in, puts on his mask.  Inside the car- two other men wearing CLOWN MASKS.
Three of a kind.  Let's do this.
One of the Clowns looks up from loading his automatic wea
That's it?  Three guys?
There's two on the roof.  Every guy  is an extra share.  Five shares is  plenty.
Six shares.  Don't forget the guy  who planned the job.
Yeah?  He thinks he can sit it out  and still take a slice, then I get  why they call him the Joker.
Grumpy cocks his weapon.  Bozo pulls the car over in fron of the GOTHAM FIRST NATIONAL BANK.
Dopey PRIES open an access panel-
Why do they call him the Joker?
I heard he wears make-up.
Make-up?
Dopey pulls out thick bundles of blue CAT 5 cables.
Yeah.  To scare people.  War paint.
Grumpy, Chuckles and Bozo get out of the car and march in the bank CARRYING ASSAULT RIFLES--

The Security Guard looks up- Grumpy FIRES into the ceilin Customers SCREAM.  Chuckles CRACKS the Security Guard. As Grumpy and Bozo round up the hostages, one of the TELL presses a button mounted beneath her window- a SILENT ALA
Dopey watches the alarm PING his handheld.
Here comes the silent alarm. (touches a button) And there it goes.  That's funny.   It didn't dial out to 911- it was  trying to reach a private number.
Behind him, Happy RAISES his silenced HANDGUN.
Is it a problem?
No, no.  I'm done here.
Happy SHOOTS.  Dopey SLUMPS.  Happy picks up his bag and  FORCES OPEN the roof access door...
...and speeds down the stairs, to the basement.  He SLAMS open the door...
...and comes face to face with a huge VAULT.
Bozo and Grumpy move down the line of hostages- Bozo hand each Hostage OBJECTS from a bag.  A GRENADE.  Grumpy foll PULLING THE PINS.
Obviously, we don't want you doing  anything with your hands other than  holding on for dear life.
BLAM.  Chuckles is BLOWN OFF HIS FEET- Grumpy and Bozo DI for cover- the Bank Manager steps out of his office, SHOT in hand.  Hostages SCRAMBLE, CLINGING their grenades...
Happy CLAMPS a DRILL to the vault- the bit SPINS- SLIDES  into the metal door- a BOLT of ELECTRICITY RIPS THROUGH T
Grumpy and Bozo cower as the Bank Manager FIRES again.
He's got three left?

Bozo raises TWO fingers.  Grumpy squeezes off a SHOT.  Th Bank Manager FIRES.  FIRES again.  Grumpy looks at Bozo, nods.  Grumpy JUMPS UP. The Bank Manager FIRES- Grumpy GRUNTS as buckshot CLIPS h shoulder.  FALLS.  The Bank Manager moves in for the kill FUMBLING for new shells.  Bozo STANDS- SHOOTS him. Bozo picks up the shotgun.  Grumpy checks his wound- it's superficial.  He struggles to his feet.
Where'd you learn to count?!
Bozo's mask stares him down.  Grumpy heads for the stairs the back.  Bozo starts loading fresh shells into the shot
You have any idea who you're stealing  from?  You and your friends are dead.
Bozo looks down at him.  Says nothing.
Happy at the vault door, barefoot, turning the tumblers w hands stuffed into his SNEAKERS.  Grumpy walks in.
They wired this thing up with 5,000  volts.  What kind of bank does that?
A mob bank.  Guess the Joker's as  crazy as they say.
Happy shrugs.  Grips the WHEEL BOLT and SPINS it.
Where's the alarm guy?
Boss told me when the guy was done I  should take him out.  One less share.
Funny, he told me something similar...
Happy FREEZES.  The wheel SPINS to a STOP- the vault DOOR CLUNKS OPEN- Happy GRABS for his weapon- SPINS to see Gru SHOOT.  Grumpy steps over Happy into the vault...
...which is filled with an eight-foot MOUNTAIN OF CASH.
Grumpy walks into the lobby, straining under several DUFF filled with cash.  He DUMPS them.  Looks at Bozo.  LAUGHS
C'mon, there's a lot to carry...
Bozo walks back into the lobby with two more DUFFELS.  Se them down on an ENORMOUS PILE.  Grumpy looks at it.
If this guy was so smart he would  have had us bring a bigger car.
Grumpy JABS his pistol in Bozo's back.  Takes his weapon.
I'm betting the Joker told you to  kill me soon as we loaded the cash.
(shakes head) No.  I kill the bus driver.
Bus driver?  What bus-

Bozo steps backwards.  SMASH.  Hostages SCREAM as the TAI END OF A YELLOW SCHOOL BUS ROCKETS through the front of t bank, SLAMMING Grumpy into the teller's window. Bozo picks up Grumpy's weapon.  Another clown OPENS the r door of the bus.  Bozo SHOOTS him.  Then loads the bags o the bus.  The wounded Bank Manager watches him.  In the  distance: SIRENS.
Think you're smart, huh?  Well, the  guy who hired you's just do the same  to you...
Bozo slowly shakes his head.
Sure he will.  Criminals in this  town used to believe in things...
Bozo turns back to the Bank Manager.  Crouches over him.
Honor.  Respect.  What do you believe,  huh?  What do you bel-
Bozo slides a GRENADE into the man's mouth.  A PURPLE THR is knotted around the pin.
I believe that what doesn't kill  you...
Bozo PULLS off his MASK.  The Bank Manager GASPS.  In the reflections of the glass DEBRIS behind the Bank Manager w see GLIMPSES of a SCARRED MOUTH and CLOWN MAKEUP.  THE JO
...simply makes you stranger.

The Bank Manager's eyes go wide.  The Joker rises, stroll towards the bus, the purple thread attached to the grenad pin UNRAVELING FROM THE PURPLE LINING of his jacket as he walks.  The Joker climbs into the bus, SHUTS the rear doo TRAPPING THE PURPLE THREAD...
Kids pour out, heading onto a long line of school buses.

As the bus pulls out, the purple thread PULLS THE PIN--  hostages scream and scurry away from the Bank Manager, wh shakes with fear as, with a FIZZ, the grenade does not  explode, but SPEWS RED SMOKE.
The School Bus pulls free of the Bank wall and pulls out  onto the street, SLIDING INTO THE LINE OF IDENTICAL BUSES HEADING PAST THE BANK.  The buses trundle past COP CARS r up the street... and we-
From the top of a brick building a SHAFT OF LIGHT comes o
A PATROLMAN looks up at the BAT-SIGNAL.  Smiles.  A DEALE standing beside a car spots the signal.  Steps back.
No, man.  I don't like it tonight.
What're you, superstitious?  You got  more chance of winning the powerball  than running into him...
DETECTIVE RAMIREZ, female, rookie detective, 30's, makes  coffee, watching a news show on the television. ON SCREEN: The host, MIKE ENGEL, lays into the MAYOR.
Mr Mayor, you were elected on a  campaign to clean up the city...  when are you going to start?
Well, Mike-

Like this so-called Batman- a lot of  people say he's doing some good that  criminals are running scared...  but  I say NO.  What kind of hero needs  to wear a mask?  You don't let  vigilantes run around breaking the  law... where does it end?   Yet, we  hear rumors that instead of trying  to arrest him the cops are using him  to do their dirty work.
I'm told our men in the Major Crimes  Unit are close to an arrest.
Hey, Wuertz- the Mayor says you're  closing in on the Batman.
WUERTZ looks up, listless.  Crumples up a paper.
The investigation is ongoing.
He throws the paper at the trash.  It rebounds off a boar headed 'BATMAN: SUSPECTS.' Lined with pictures: Abraham  Lincoln.  Elvis.  The Abominable Snowman.
Ramirez comes out onto the roof.  LIEUTENANT GORDON sits a SEARCHLIGHT.  She hands Gordon a cup of coffee.
Ever intending to see your wife again,  Lieutenant?
I thought you had to go look after  your mother, detective.
They checked her back into hospital.
I'm sorry.
(making light) Least there she's got someone round  the clock.  Unlike your wife. (looks at bat-signal) He hasn't shown?
Gordon gets up.  Looks into the sky at the bat-signal.
Often doesn't.  But I like reminding  everybody that he's out there.
Why wouldn't he come?
Hopefully... Because he's busy.
Two black SUV's pull onto the top floor.  A large man eme the CHECHEN.  A BODYGUARD points at the sky.  The Chechen peers up at the BAT-SIGNAL.  Shrugs.
That's why we bring dogs.
BODYGUARD 2 opens the back door- three enormous ROTWEILER emerge, GROWLING.  The Chechen crouches, KISSING the dogs
My little princes...
(to bodyguards) The Batman's invisible to you fools...  but my little princes...  they can  find human meat in complete darkness.
The Chechen moves to the second SUV, reaches in and DRAGS out a skinny, wild-eyed JUNKIE by his hair.
(babbling) No!  No get 'em off me!  Off me!
The Chechen drags the Junkie towards a battered white van The van's REAR DOORS OPEN... two armed THUGS emerge, carr BARRELS... a third hovers in the dark interior.
Look!  Look what your drugs did to  my customers!
Buyer beware...
The figure emerges: SCARECROW.  Wearing his mask.
I told your man my compound would  take you places.  I never said they'd  be places you wanted to go.
My business is repeat customers.
If you don't like what I have to  offer, buy from someone else.   Assuming Batman left anyone else to  buy from.
The Chechen frowns.  THE DOGS START BARKING.
(nervous) He's here.
A BURLY THUG at the periphery is suddenly SUCKED into the darkness.  In his place a shadow straightens, revealing  POINTED BAT-EARS against the glittering skyline.
Come on, sonofbitch- my dogs are  hungry, pity there's only one of  you...

A BODYGUARD to the side DISAPPEARS with a scream, and a S BAT-SHADOW appears. The Chechen looks taken aback.  Three more BAT-SHADOWS  appear... even the dogs stop growling. BOOM!  A hole appears in the SUV next to the Chechen.  Th first bat-shadow steps into the light carrying a SHOTGUN. CHAOS as men scatter and the rooftop erupts in GUNFIRE. Chechen TURNS as he hears one of his men SCREAM.
Loose the dogs!

A Bodyguard releases the DOGS- they RACE, SALIVATING, int the darkness... The Dogs RACE towards a Bat-Shadow- the first dog LEAPS,  gets its JAWS around the Bat-Shadow's throat... Scarecrow ducks behind the van- holes PUNCHED in the side shotgun blasts right behind him.  He starts to climb into the driver's seat- The muzzle of a shotgun is pressed to the back of his hea a bat-shadow is behind him- he SPRAYS him with FEAR TOXIN the bat-shadow collapses to the ground, SCREAMING.  The  Chechen, cowering from gunfire, looks down at him.
Not the real thing.
How you know?
We're old friends.
A HUGE BLACK SHAPE SLAMS down onto a row of parked cars. The BATMOBILE.
That's more like it.
The Chechen's men BLAST away at the front of the car: the bullets SPARK off its monstrous surface harmlessly...
The cockpit is EMPTY.  One of the screens reads "LOITER". The shooting STOPS.  The screen switches to "INTIMIDATE"

The men STARE at the Batmobile for a quiet moment... BOOM The Batmobile CANNONS blast cars all around the men-  A bat-shadow lines up his shotgun on a running bodyguard- CLUNK- a BLACK GAUNTLET grasps the barrel and BENDS it up with a HOWL of tortured steel- the bat-shadow looks into face of the Batman.  The REAL BATMAN. The Bat-shadow STUMBLES BACKWARDS in terror, leaving the  bent shotgun in Batman's hand.  Batman OPENS his hand,  revealing a PNEUMATIC MANGLE hidden in his palm- Batman bears down on the dogs mauling another bat-shadow- DRAWS his GRAPPLING GUN and SHOOTS his grapple into the f Batman's leg and RIPS him from the dogs, one dog HANGING as Batman pulls the unconscious man away... the Chechen R down the ramp towards the exit... As Batman KICKS the dog off the fake Batman- the Chechen  gets into his SUV- another dog LOCKS ITS JAWS around Batm forearm, RIPPING, TEARING- Batman SWINGS THE DOG OVER HIS HEAD- SMASHES it against the ground- its jaws OPEN... Batman rises, an engine RACES behind him- he can't turn i time- BLAM- he's SLAMMED sideways by the speeding van.

Scarecrow, driving, NODS at him and hits the gas... Batma raises his hand, revealing his jointed mangle and pistons The mangle STRAIGHTENS and ROTATES from his palm to the k edge of his opened hand... Batman CHOPS straight through the windshield- pulls his h out and CHOPS again- the mangle gets STUCK- Scarecrow ste towards a column...

Batman can't free himself- he turns a dial on his forearm piston- EXPLOSIVE BOLTS blow, freeing his gauntlet from t mangle- he ROLLS free of the van as it SCRAPES the column and barrels down the circular exit ramp. Batman rises.  A phony batman lying on the ground watches Batman climbs up to the edge of the ten-story corkscrew r and stands there, waiting for something. After a moment he JUMPS... and falls... ten stories... He's about to hit the exit ramp- the van appears- his cap POPS OPEN- he SLAMS into the roof, CRUSHING the cab.
The Chechen's men are lined up against the wall, bound wi zip-ties.  So are the fake batmen.  Batman DUMPS Scarecro next to the three "Batmen", RIPS his mask off.
We're trying to help you!
I don't need help.
Not my diagnosis.
Batman silences Scarecrow with his boot.  Turns to "Batma
Don't let me find you out here again.
Batman moves towards the Batmobile.
You need us!  There's only one of  you-it's war out here!
Batman gets into the Batmobile.
What gives you the right?!  What's  the difference between you and me?!
As the Canopy hisses shut-
I'm not wearing hockey pads.
The "Batman" looks down at his makeshift costume as the  Batmobile ROARS past.
LIEUTENANT GORDON ducks the barrage of SHOUTED QUESTIONS  from press and picks his way into the lobby of the bank.
FORENSIC SPECIALISTS work the room.  Ramirez hands Gordon PRINTS- indicates the surveillance cameras.
He can't resist showing us his face.
Gordon looks at the grainy blow-up of THE JOKER'S FACE:  sweating clown makeup plastered thick around the mouth.
Put this out, by morning we can put  a big top over central holding and  sell tickets.  What's he hiding under  that makeup?
Gordon approaches a FORENSIC PHOTOGRAPHER shooting Grumpy body.  Gordon crouches to look at his clown mask.  Batman steps from the shadows.  Gordon nods at Ramirez.
Give us a minute, please, people!
The Forensic team and Ramirez leave.  Gordon hands Batman the blow-up of the Joker.
Him again.  Who are the others?
Another bunch of small timers.
Batman pulls a DEVICE from his belt- moves to the bundles cash scattered near the clown's body.  The device PINGS. Batman picks up a BUNDLE.  Hands it to Gordon.
Some of the marked bills I gave you.
My detectives have been making drug  buys with them for weeks.  This bank  was another drop for the mob.  That  makes five banks- we've found the  bulk of their dirty cash.
Time to move in.
Gordon waves the photo.
What about this Joker guy?
One man or the entire mob?  He can  wait.
We'll have to hit all banks  simultaneously.  SWAT teams, backup.
Gordon holds up the bundle of banknotes.
When the new D.A. gets wind of this,  he'll want in.
Do you trust him?
Be hard to keep him out.
Gordon bags the cash.
I hear he's as stubborn as you.
But Batman is already gone.
Alfred walks past soaring downtown views as he carries a  breakfast tray through the vast, empty penthouse.  He sto looking at a still-made bed.  Alfred sighs, turns.

Alfred gets out of the Rolls carrying a thermos.  He walk towards a RAILWAY BRIDGE, stops at a FREIGHT CONTAINER  sitting, lopsided, on blocks.  Alfred unlocks the RUSTY  PADLOCK AND CHAIN.  Steps inside.
Alfred FUMBLES in the dark- bangs his elbow- A HISS as th FLOOR LOWERS... Alfred sinks down into...

The container floor lowers on a giant PISTON.  Alfred ste off into a large, LOW-CEILINGED CONCRETE CHAMBER.  The  Batmobile sits in the middle.  Machines- 3D printers, pow tools- dot the high-tech space.  At one end, Wayne sits a bank of monitors watching CCTV footage of the bank robber
Be nice when Wayne Manor's rebuilt  and you can swap not sleeping in a  penthouse for not sleeping in a  mansion.
Alfred places a cup of coffee in front of Wayne, who is  STITCHING up a cut on his arm.
(takes needle) When you stitch yourself up you make  a bloody mess.
But I learn from my mistakes.
You ought to be pretty knowledgeable  by now, then.
My armor... I'm carrying too much  weight- I need to be faster.
I'm sure Mr. Fox can oblige. (looks at wound) Did you get mauled by a tiger?
A dog. (off look) A big dog.  There were more copycats  last night, Alfred.  With guns.
Perhaps you could hire some of them  and take weekends off.
This wasn't exactly what I had in  mind when I said I wanted to inspire  people.
I know.  But things are improving.   Look at the new District Attorney...
Wayne indicates a monitor: a handsome MAN in a suit.
I am.  Closely.  I need to know if  he can be trusted.
Alfred looks at other images- the D.A. at a meeting.   Campaigning.  Helping someone out of a cab: RACHEL.
Are you interested in his character...  or his social circle?
Who Rachel spends her time with is  her business.
Well, I trust you're not following  me on my day off.
If you ever took one, I might.
Alfred bites the thread.  Examines his stitches.  Looks a the SCARS criss-crossing Wayne's shoulders.
Know your limits, Master Wayne.
Batman has no limits.
Well, you do, sir.
I can't afford to know them.
And what happens the day you find  out?
We all know how much you like to say  'I told you so'.
That day, Master Wayne, even I won't  want to.  Probably.
HARVEY DENT bursts into the courtroom.  Assistant D.A. RA DAWES, look up, ANNOYED.
Sorry I'm late, folks.
Rachel leans in to Dent, speaking under her breath.
Where were you?
Worried you'd have to step up?
I know the briefs backwards.
Dent pulls a large silver dollar out of his pocket.  Grin
Well, then, fair's fair: heads, I'll  take it.  Tails, he's all yours.
Dent FLIPS.  Shows it to Rachel- heads.
You're flipping coins to see who  leads?
My father's lucky coin.  As I recall,  it got me my first date with you.
I'm serious, Harvey, you don't leave  things like this to chance.
I don't. (sincere) I make my own luck.
Dent looks across at the defendant- SAL MARONI.
I thought the DA just played golf  with the Mayor, things like that.
Tee-off's 1:30.  More than enough  time to put you away for life, Sally.
The BAILIFFS lead a THIN MAN into the witness box.  ROSSI
Rossi takes a SIP of water.  Dent works the room.
With Carmine Falcone in Arkham,  someone must've stepped up to run  the so-called family. (Rossi nods) Is this man in the courtroom today? (Rossi nods again) Could you identify him for us, please?
Dent turns to Maroni, who is poker-faced.  Dent smiles.
You win, counselor.  It was me.
Dent's smile disappears.  He turns back to Rossi.
I've got a sworn statement from you  that this man, Salvatore Maroni, is  the new head of the Falcone crime  family.
Maroni?  He's a fall guy.  I'm the  brains of the organization.
LAUGHS from the gallery.  Dent turns to the JUDGE.
Permission to treat the witness as  hostile?
Hostile?  I'll show you hostile.

Rossi JUMPS UP, points a GUN at Dent's face.  SCREAMS fro the gallery.  Rossi PULLS the TRIGGER- the gun MISFIRES w a POP.  Dent steps forward, grabs the GUN- DECKS Rossi wi a RIGHT CROSS- unloads the GUN and sets it down in front Maroni.
Ceramic 28 caliber.  Made in China.   If you want to kill a public servant,  Mr. Maroni, I recommend you buy  American.
Everyone STARES, open-mouthed, as Dent adjusts his tie. Bailiffs are wrestling Rossi from the box-
But, your honor, I'm not done...
Rachel, excited, leads Dent through the lobby.
We'll never link the gun to Maroni,  so we can't charge him, but I'll  tell you one thing- the fact they  tried to kill you means we're getting  to them.
Glad you're so pleased, Rachel.  I'm  fine by the way.
Rachel turns to Dent.  Smooths his lapels.
Harvey, you're Gotham's D.A.- if  you're not getting shot at, you're  not doing your job. (smiles) 'Course if you said you were rattled  we could take the rest of the day...
Can't.  I dragged the head of the  Major Crimes Unit down here.
Jim Gordon?  He's a friend- try to  be nice.
Gordon stands as Dent enters.  The two men shake.
Word is you've got a hell of a right  cross.  Shame Sal's going to walk.
Well, good thing about the mob is  they keep giving you second chances.
Dent picks up a bundle of bills from the heist.
Lightly irradiated bills.  Fancy  stuff for a city cop.  Have help?
We liaise with various agencies-
Save it, Gordon.  I want to meet  him.
Official policy is to arrest the  vigilante known as Batman on sight.
And that flood light on top of M.C.U.?
If you have any concerns about...   malfunctioning equipment... take  them up with maintenance, counselor.
Dent tosses the bills back onto his desk.  Annoyed.

I've put every known money launderer  in Gotham behind bars.  But the mob  is still getting its money out.  I  think you and your "friend" have  found the last game in town and you're  trying to hit 'em where it hurts:  their wallets.  Bold.  You gonna  count me in?
In this town, the fewer people know  something, the safer the operation.
Gordon, I don't like that you've got  your own special unit, and I don't  like that it's full of cops I  investigated at internal affairs.

If I didn't work with cops you'd  investigated while you were making  your name at I.A.- I'd be working  alone.  I don't get political points  for being an idealist- I have to do  the best I can with what I have.
Dent looks at Gordon.  Considering how to proceed.
You want me to back warrants for  search and seizure on five banks  without telling me who we're after?
I can give you the names of the banks.
Well, that's a start.  I'll get you  your warrants.  But I want your trust.
(rises) You don't have to sell me, Dent.  We  all know you're Gotham's white knight.
(grins) I hear they've got a different  nickname for me down at M.C.U..
Gordon smiles.
LUCIUS FOX, CEO of Wayne Enterprises, and the board liste to LAU, 40s, CEO of L.S.I. Holdings.
In China L.S.I. Holdings stands for  dynamic new growth.  A joint Chinese  venture with Wayne Enterprises will  be a powerhouse.
Well, Mr. Lau, I speak for the rest  of the board, and Mr. Wayne, in  expressing our own excitement...
The Chinese look to the head of the table: Wayne, ASLEEP.
Fox shows Lau to the elevator.  He's joined by, REESE, 30 an ambitious M and A consultant lawyer.
It's OK, Mr. Fox.  Everyone knows  who really runs Wayne Enterprises.
We'll be in touch as soon as our  people have wrapped up the diligence.
The elevator doors close.  Reese frowns.
Sir, I know Mr. Wayne's curious how  his trust fund gets replenished but  frankly... it's embarrassing.
Fox heads for his office, Reese in tow.
You worry about the diligence, Mr.  Reese.  I'll worry about Bruce Wayne.
It's done- the numbers are solid.
(smiles) Do it again.  Wouldn't want the trust  fund to run out, would we?
Wayne is standing by the window.

Another long night? (Wayne smiles) This joint venture was your idea,  and the consultants love it, but I'm  not convinced.  L.S.I.'s grown 8  percent annually, like clockwork.   They must have a revenue stream that's  off the books.  Maybe even illegal.
OK.  Cancel the deal.
(looks at Wayne) You already knew.
I needed a closer look at their books.
Fox looks at Wayne.  Wry.
Anything else you can trouble me  for?
I need a new suit.
(looks him over) Three buttons is a little nineties.
I'm not talking about fashion, Mr.Fox,  so much as function.
Wayne pulls some diagrams.  Fox looks them over.
You want to be able to turn your  head?
Sure make backing out of the driveway  easier.
I'll see what I can do.
Rachel and Dent at a table.  Dent looks a little intimida by the surroundings.
It took three weeks to get a  reservation and I had to tell them I  worked for the government.
Really?
This city health inspector's not  afraid to pull strings.
Rachel smiles.  Then, over Dent's shoulder, she sees Wayn enter, accompanied by a beautiful woman.
What?
Rachel!  Fancy that.
Yes, Bruce.  Fancy that.
Rachel, Natascha.  Natascha, Rachel.
(Russian accent) Hello.
The famous Bruce Wayne.  Rachel's  told me everything about you.
I certainly hope not.
Bruce, this is Harvey Dent.
Let's put a couple tables together.
I don't know if they'll let us-
They should!  I own the place.
For how long?  About three weeks?
How'd you know?
Natascha, aren't you...?
Prima ballerina for the Moscow Ballet.
Harvey's taking me next week.
You're into ballet, Harvey?
No.  He knows I am.
An extra table arrives.
They finish up dinner.
No, come on- how could you want to  raise children in a city like this?
I was raised here.  I turned out OK.
Is Wayne Manor in the city limits?
Rachel gives Dent a withering look.
The Palisades?  Sure.  You know, as  our new D.A. you might want to figure  out where your jurisdiction ends.
I'm talking about the kind of city  that idolizes a masked vigilante...
Gotham's proud of an ordinary man  standing up for what's right.
Gotham needs heroes like you- elected  officials, not a man who thinks he's  above the law.
Exactly.  Who appointed the Batman?
We did.  All of us who stood by and  let scum take control of our city.
Wayne watches Dent.  Sees his passion.
But this is a democracy, Harvey.
When their enemies were at the gate,  the Romans would suspend democracy  and appoint one man to protect the  city.  It wasn't considered an honor.   It was considered public service.
And the last man they asked to protect  the republic was named Caesar.  He  never gave up that power.

Well, I guess you either die a hero  or you live long enough to see  yourself become the villain.  Look,  whoever the Batman is, he doesn't  want to spend the rest of his life  doing this.  How could he?  Batman's  looking for someone to take up his  mantle.
Someone like you, Mr. Dent?
Maybe.  If I'm up to it.
Natascha reaches up and covers the top half of Dent's fac
But what if Harvey Dent is the caped  crusader?
If I were sneaking out every night  someone would've noticed by now.
Dent takes Rachel's hand.  Rachel glances at Wayne.  Awkw
Well, you've sold me, Dent.  I'm  gonna throw you a fundraiser.
That's nice of you, Bruce, but I'm  not up for reelection for three years.   That stuff won't start for-
I don't think you understand.  One  fundraiser with my pals, you'll never  need another cent.
A line of high-end AUTOS dispenses well dressed GANGSTERS
The Chechen walks through a METAL DETECTOR manned by two  CHINESE.  A lean, African-American man, 50's, is being wa This is GAMBOL.  He nods at the Chechen, wary.
Gotham's most notorious GANGSTERS.  A door opens, and two BURLY CHINESE enter, carrying a TV.  They set it down on end of the table.
The hell is this...?
The screen flickers to life: Lau.  The room ERUPTS.
Gentlemen, please.  As you're all  aware, one of our deposits was stolen.   A relatively small amount: 68 million.
Who's stupid enough steal from us?
I'm told the man who arranged the  heist calls himself Joker.
Who the hell is that?
Two-bit whack-job wears a cheap purple  suit and make-up.  He's not the  problem- he's a nobody. (looks at Lau) The problem is our money being tracked  by the cops.
Murmurs of surprise.
Thanks to Mr. Maroni's well-placed  sources we know that police have  indeed identified our banks using  marked bills and are planning to  seize your funds today-
Everyone starts SHOUTING at once.
Gordon sits in a SWAT van outside a bank.  Stephens is ou another.  Ramirez a third... SWAT teams CHECK WEAPONS and prepare move...
Lau waits for the noise to subside.
You promised safe, clean money launder-
With the investigation ongoing, none  of you can risk hanging on to your  own proceeds.  And since the  enthusiastic new D.A. has put all my  competitors out of business, I'm  your only option.
So what are you proposing?
Moving all deposits to one secure  location.  Not a bank.
Where, then?
Obviously, no one can know but me.
If the police were to gain leverage  over one of you everyone's money  would be at stake.
What stops them getting to you?
As the money is moved I go to Hong  Kong.  Far from Dent's jurisdiction.  And the Chinese will not extradite  one of their own.

From the back of the room comes LAUGHTER.  It grows and g until it fills the room.  All eyes turn: The Joker.  Sweaty clown makeup obscuring the AWFUL SCARS which widen his mouth into a PERMANENT, GHOULISH SMILE.
I thought I told bad jokes.
Give me one reason I shouldn't have  my boy here pull your head off.
The Joker pulls out a freshly sharpened pencil.
How about a magic trick?
The Joker SLAMS the pencil into the table, leaving it UPR
I'll make this pencil disappear.

Gambol nods.  His BODYGUARD MOVES at the Joker- who SIDES GRIPS his head- SLAMS it, FACE DOWN, onto the table... The Bodyguard goes LIMP and slides off of the table.  The PENCIL is gone.  MAGIC.  The Joker BOWS.  Grins at Gambol
And by the way, the suit wasn't cheap.   You should know.  You bought it.
Gambol STANDS, furious.  The Chechen stops him.
Sit.  I wanna hear proposition.
The Joker nods his thanks.  Rises.
A year ago these cops and lawyers  wouldn't dare cross any of you.   What happened?  Did your balls drop  off?  See, a guy like me-
A freak.
Laughs.  Which the Joker tries to ignore.

A guy like me... I know why you're  holding your little group therapy  session in broad daylight.  I know  why you're afraid to go out at night.   Batman.  He's shown Gotham your true  colors.  And Dent's just the  beginning. (indicates Lau) And as for his so-called plan- Batman  has no jurisdiction.  He'll find him  and make him squeal. (smiles at Lau) I can tell the squealers every time.
What you propose?
It's simple.  Kill the Batman.
Jeers.  Laughter.
If it's so easy why haven't you done  it already?
Like my mother used to tell me- if  you're good at something, never do  it for free.
How much you want?
Half.
Laughter.  The Joker shrugs.  Rises.
You don't deal with this now, soon  Gambol won't even be able to get a  nickel for his grandma-
Enough from the clown.
Gambol gets up, MOVING at the Joker, who casually opens h coat, revealing EXPLOSIVES wired to his chest.  Gambol st
Let's not blow this out of all  proportion.
Gambol stares at the Joker.  Hard.
You think you can steal from us and  just walk away?  I'm putting the  word out- 5 hundred grand for this  clown dead.  A million alive, so I  get to teach him some manners, first.
The Joker shrugs.  Turns to the assembled.
Let me know when you change your  minds.
The Joker strolls out.  Maroni turns to Lau.
How soon can you move the money?
Gordon hurries up the steps to a bank.  SWAT teams rush t various banks.
I already have...
A CHINESE MAN finishes loading a TRACTOR TRAILER with cas boxes.  The truck pulls out into a CONVOY.
Gordon stands in an almost empty bank vault.  Furious.
For obvious reasons I couldn't wait  for your permission...
The shot of Lau on the TV widens...
Rest assured, your money is safe.
He is already on his private jet. IN THE SKY: THE BAT SIGNAL.
Batman emerges from the shadows.  The man next to the glo spotlight turns: DENT.
You're a hard man to reach.
Gordon BURSTS onto the rooftop, weapon drawn.  Sees Dent.
Lau's halfway to Hong Kong- if you'd  asked, I could have taken his passport-  I told you to keep me in the loop.
Yeah?  All that was left in the vaults  were the marked bills- they knew we  were coming!  As soon as your office  got involved, there's a leak-
My office?!  You're sitting down  here with scum like Wuertz and  Ramirez... (off look) Oh, yeah, Gordon- I almost had your  rookie cold on a racketeering beef.
Don't try to cloud the fact that  clearly Maroni's got people in your  office, Dent.
Dent turns to Batman.
We need Lau back, but the Chinese  won't extradite a national under any  circumstances.
If I get him to you, can you get him  to talk?
I'll get him to sing.
We're going after the mob's life  savings.  Things will get ugly.
I knew the risks when I took this  job, lieutenant.  Same as you. (turns to Batman) How will you get him back, anyway?
Batman is gone.  Dent looks around, startled.  Gordon smi
He does that.
Fox gets up from behind his desk.
Our Chinese friend left town before  I could tell him the deal is off.
I'm sure you've always wanted to go  to Hong Kong.
Fox opens the door to a private elevator.
Fox turns a key.
What's wrong with a phone call?
I think Mr. Lau deserves a more  personal touch.
Fox leads Wayne off the elevator and into the vast space.
For high altitude jumps, you need  oxygen and stabilizers.  I must say-  compared to your usual requests,  jumping out of an airplane is pretty  straightforward.
Lucius stops at a cabinet, pulls open a drawer and hauls an oxygen tank and ribbed rubber hosing.
How about getting back into the plane?
I can recommend a good travel agent.
Without it landing.
That's more like it, Mr. Wayne.
He shuts the drawer.  Moves off, thinking.
I don't think I have anything here. The CIA had a program in the '60s  for getting their people out of hot  spots.  Called Sky Hook.  Now-
Fox opens a cabinet to reveal COMPONENTS OF A NEW BAT-SUI ARMORED PLATING secured to mesh.  Wayne lifts an arm.
Hardened kevlar plates on a titanium- dipped fiber tri-weave for  flexibility...
Wayne examines DOUBLE BLADE SCALLOPS on the gauntlet...
You'll be lighter, faster, more  agile...
Wayne flinches as the BLADES FIRE, SPINNING LIKE THROWING STARS, NARROWLY MISSING his ear, embedding themselves in filing cabinet.  Fox looks at him.
Perhaps you should read the  instructions, first.
Sorry.
Fox picks up the chest, demonstrating its flexibility.
Now, there's a trade-off... the spread  of the plates gives you weak spots.   You'll be more vulnerable to gunfire  and knives.
We wouldn't want things getting too  easy, would we? (picks up suit) How will it hold up against dogs?
Fox looks at him quizzically.
You talking chihuahuas or rotweilers? (Wayne smiles) It should do fine against cats.
Wayne examines a parachute harness.  Alfred unfolds a dia of a NAVY CARGO PLANE with a giant "V" mounted on the fro
I found one.  In Arizona.  Very nice  man says it will take him a week to  get it running.  And he takes cash.   What about a flight crew?
South Korean smugglers.  They run  flights into Pyongyang, below radar  the whole way.  Did you think of an  alibi?
Alfred looks quite pleased with himself.
Oh, yes.

Rachel and Dent arrive to find the box office SHUTTERED. sign:'PERFORMANCE CANCELED.' A newspaper story is taped t the glass.  Over a picture of BRUCE WAYNE ON A YACHT: LOVE BOAT- Billionaire absconds with entire Moscow ballet
Alfred, picks his way over twelve SUNBATHING BALLERINAS. Wayne looks up from a newspaper.  Alfred points to a SEAP gently touching down across the bay.
I believe your plane is here.
You look tired, Alfred.  Will you be  all right without me?
A Ballerina rolls over- waves the suntan lotion at Alfred
If you can tell me the Russian for  'apply your own bloody suntan lotion.'
Wayne tosses a large, waterproof kit bag into the water a JUMPS in after it.  Begins swimming over to the sea-plane
Gambol racks up.  A bodyguard steps into the room.
Somebody here for you.
Gambol looks to the back- three rough customers are waiti
They say they've killed the Joker.
They've come for the reward.
They bring proof?
They say they've brought the body.

The bodyguards FLOP a BODY wrapped in garbage bags onto t table.  The BOUNTY HUNTERS wait in the corner.  Gambol pu back one of the garbage bags, revealing the Joker's blood face.  Gambol spits.  Turns to face the bounty hunters.
So.  Dead you get five hundred-
Behind Gambol, the Joker SITS UP- THRUSTS knives into the bodyguards' chests.  Gambol spins to see a crazy grin on Joker's spit-dribbled face-
How about alive?
The Joker gets a switchblade in Gambol's mouth- SHARP MET PULLING THE CHEEK TAUT.  The Bounty Hunters subdue the  remaining bodyguards.
Wanna know how I got these scars?

My father was a drinker and a fiend.   He'd beat mommy right in front of  me.  One night he goes off crazier  than usual, mommy gets the kitchen  knife to defend herself.  He doesn't  like that.  Not.  One.  Bit.
The Joker TUGS Gambols cheek with the blade.

So, me watching, he takes the knife  to her, laughing while he does it.   Turns to me and says 'why so serious?'   Comes at me with the knife- 'why so  serious?'  Sticks the blade in my  mouth- 'Let's put a smile on that  face' and...
The Joker looks up at the ASHEN FACES of the remaining Bo Guards.  Smiles.
Why so serious?
The Joker FLICKS his wrist- the Body Guards flinch as Gam goes down.  The Joker turns to them.
Now, our organization is small, but  we've got a lot of potential for  aggressive expansion... so which of  you fine gentlemen would like to  join our team?
The three bodyguards all nod.  The Joker SNAPS a pool cue
Only one slot open right now- so  we're going to have try-outs.
The Joker drops the broken cue in the middle of the men.
Make it fast.
The men stare at each other.  Then at the jagged pool cue
A HELICOPTER touches down on one of the hotel's twin heli Two L.S.I. VPs approach, heads ducked.  Fox gets out- the shake hands, shouting over the engine-
Welcome to Hong Kong, Mr. Fox!  Mr.  Lau regrets he is unable to meet you  in person.  But with his current  legal difficulties...!
I understand!
The VPs usher Fox towards security.
I'm afraid for security reasons I  have to ask for your mobile phone.
Lucius hands his phone to a SECURITY GUARD, who puts the  phone in a box underneath his station.
Fox and Lau eat lunch in a dining room overlooking the ci

I must apologize for leaving Gotham  in the middle of our negotiations.   This misunderstanding with the Gotham  police force... I couldn't let such  a thing threaten my company.  A  businessman of your stature will  understand.  But with you here... we  can continue.
Well, it was good of you to bring me  out here in such style, Mr. Lau.   But I've actually come...
A CELL PHONE rings.  Fox pulls out a second, identical, p Fox presses the off switch and places the phone by his pl
We do not allow cell phones in-
Sorry.  Forgot I had it.  So, I've  come to explain why we're going to  have to put our deal on hold...
Lau stares at Fox.  Clearly furious.  Fox smiles.
We can't afford to be seen to do  business with... well, whatever it  is you're accused of being.  A  businessman of your stature will  understand.
Lau gets up.  Silent.  Fox retrieves his phone.  Stands.
(cold) I think, Mr. Fox, that a simple phone  call might have sufficed.
Well, I do love Chinese food.  And  Mr. Wayne didn't want you to think  we'd been deliberately wasting your  time.
Just accidentally wasting it.
(laughs) That's very good- "accidentally."   Very good.  I'll be sure and tell  Mr. Wayne that he was wrong about  you not having a sense of humor.

Lucius walks back through security.  Nods at the VP, who  bows, offering Lucius his cell phone.  Lucius shakes his  head, holds up the IDENTICAL PHONE.  The VP smiles, nods, puts the phone back into the tray with several others.

Two SMUGGLERS steal glances at Wayne, crouched at the rea in balaclava and flight suit.  The COPILOT signals Wayne, who pulls on his oxygen mask and stands up.  The rear of plane OPENS.  Wayne steps to the edge, then JUMPS.

Moving across the water towards Hong Kong harbor...tiny f DROPS into frame, PLUMMETING towards the water- SPEEDING past the highest floors of skyscrapers, seconds  from impact.  Wayne PULLS the chute- DROPS into the water
Wayne pulls himself out of the water, dragging up his pac
Wayne stops halfway up the crowded commuter escalator.  H takes a camera and lines up a shot like any tourist.
There's a better view from the peak  tram.
Wayne turns to find Fox standing there, street map out.
How's the view from L.S.I. Holdings?
Restricted.  Lau's holed up in there  good and tight.  Here...
Fox shows Wayne the phone.  The display: a 3-D map of Lau office suite.  Wayne takes the phone, impressed.
What's this?
I had R and D work it up- it sends  out high frequencies and records the  response time to map an environment.
(smiles) Sonar.  Just like a b-
Submarine.  Like a submarine.
And the other device?
In place.
Wayne nods, moves away.
Mr. Wayne? (Wayne turns) Good luck.
Moving towards the tallest building in the glittering sky to find Wayne, crouched on the roof.  The blades of his  gauntlets CLICK into place.  He dons the helmet-like cowl

His "cape" is in the form of a hard faceted PACK. He stands- pulls two black boxes from his belt, CLICKS th together and UNFOLDS them into a RIFLE-LIKE DEVICE.  Batm SCOPES a second, lower building.  Adjust a setting and FI four times... Four small STICKY BOMBS SLAP onto the glass of the lower  building.  They have visible timers which are COUNTING DO

Lucius' cell phone GLOWS in the box under the Security Gu desk.  CHARACTERS race across the screen. Then the monitor FLICKERS off, the lights DIM and all of security doors in the front of the building OPEN at once. The Guard grabs his radio- CALLS FOR HELP...

Batman LAUNCHES into the glittering night, DROPPING from tall tower... his pack BURSTS OPEN, becoming his BAT WING he GLIDES down to the lower building, STREAKING around it BANKING HARD to line up with a window in the rear...
Lau is talking on the phone, staring at a profit projecti on a flat screen monitor.  Suddenly the room goes dark.
As Batman HURTLES towards the glass he COLLAPSES his wing WRAPPING his cape around himself and CANNONBALLING THROUG
ROLLING across the floor in a flurry of broken glass...

location: LAU'S OFFICE, TOP FLOOR, L.S.I. HOLDINGS

text: Lau pulls out a HANDGUN.
Lau steps into the hallway.  His BODYGUARDS are waiting f him, carrying FLASHLIGHTS.
Where the hell are the cops?
Coming.
What the hell am I paying them for?
They head for the stairwell.
A small ARMY of Hong Kong police lead by a HONG KONG DETE descends on the building.

Lau and his men make their way out onto the mezzanine. Across the room, something makes a CRASHING SOUND.  Lau's men fan out, trying to cover the room with their flashlig Suddenly, one of the flashlights goes DARK.  Then another Someone SCREAMS. Lau FIRES.  Then FIRES again.  The muzzle flash from his  weapon STROBES the room.
Cops SWARM into the building.  A LOBBY SECURITY GUARD dir the Hong Kong Detective where to go...

Lau LOCKS the door.  RELOADS.  The door is KICKED open. FIRES.  No one is there. Lau stares, finger restless on the trigger.  From his rig a NOISE.  He turns and FIRES. In the muzzle FLASH: Batman, bearing down on him like a d Lau FIRES, and FIRES again as Batman TACKLES him.  Batman pulls out a SMALL PACK- STRAPS it onto Lau- The COUNTER on the sticky bombs hits 0- The Hong Kong Detective and the Cops BURST into the room- the WALL AND CEILING BEHIND BATMAN AND LAU EXPLODES- reve the dawn sky above Hong Kong. The Detective looks around as he hears a LOW RUMBLE...

Batman JERKS the RIPCORD on Lau's pack.  Cops cower as a  WEATHER BALLOON EXPLODES out of the pack, unreeling high- test nylon.  The Cops cock their weapons. Lau looks up.  Bemused.  The weather balloon is two hundr feet up, swaying gently.  The RUMBLE BUILDS... Suddenly, a MASSIVE C-130 ROARS over.  The large V on the front of the plane SNAGS the line- Lau and BATMAN are YAN

head_text.subj: THROUGH THE HOLE IN THE CEILING--

text: Lau SCREAMS as he and Batman SOAR UP INTO THE DAWN SKY... The Detective looks up.  Batman and Lau are gone.
Gordon is looking through case files.  Ramirez walks in.
You're gonna want to see this.
Gordon follows Ramirez through a CROWD of excited cops. the ground, trussed like a chicken- Lau.  A sign taped to his chest: 'Please deliver to Lieutenant Gordon.'
Lau sits next to his sleazy lawyer, EVANS.  Rachel walks
Give us the money and we'll deal.
The money is the only reason I'm  still alive.
Rachel leans forward, speaking softly.  Clearly.
You mean when they hear that you've  helped us they're going to kill you?
Are you threatening my client?
No, I'm just assuming your client's  cooperation with this investigation. As will everyone. (moves to the door) Enjoy your stay in County, Mr.Lau.
Wait. (Rachel stops) I won't give you the money, but I'll  give you my clients.  All of them.
You were a glorified accountant-  what could you have on all of them  that we could charge?
I'm good with calculation- I handled  all their investments.  One big pot.
Dent hits a buzzer.  Turns to Gordon.
I've got it.  RICO.  If their money  was pooled we can charge all of them  as one criminal conspiracy.
Charge them with what?
Rachel enters.
In a RICO case if we can charge any  of the conspirators with a felony-
We can charge all of them with it.
Dent nods at Rachel, excited.
Rachel comes back in.
Mr. Lau, do you have details of this  communal fund?  Ledgers, notebooks...?
(smiles) Immunity, protection and a chartered  plane back to Hong Kong.
Once you've testified in open court.   So with your clients locked up, what  happens to all that money?
Like I said- I'm good with  calculation.
Dent and Gordon watch Lau.
He can't go to County.  I'll keep  him here in the holding cells.
What is this Gordon, your fortress?
You trust them over at County?
I don't trust them here.
Lau stays.
It's your call, Lieutenant.  Be right.
I am, counselor.
Dent stands in front of a small crowd of reporters.
The Chinese government claim their  international rights have been broken.
I don't know about Mr. Lau's travel  arrangements...
Dent's press conference plays on a TV in the corner.
(grins) ...but I'm sure glad he's back.
Maroni and the Chechen are watching the TV.
I put word out.  We hire the clown.
(off look) He was right.  We have to fix real  problem.  Batman.
Maroni shakes his head.  Spots Gordon walking over dangli a pair of handcuffs.  Nods at the TV.
Our boy looks good on the tube.
You sure you want to embarrass me in  front of my friends, Lieutenant?
Don't worry, they're coming, too.
Gordon points out the window to a PRISON BUS.
Prison buses in every neighborhood.  COPS load them with  CRIMINALS.  Stephens puts Crime Boss in a prison bus.
JUDGE SURRILLO reads the list of charges.
...849 counts racketeering, 246 counts  fraud, 87 counts conspiracy murder...
Judge Surrillo turns the page.  A PLAYING CARD sits there A Joker.  He glances at it, curious, puts it to one side.
...how do the defendants plead?
An ARMY of DEFENSE LAWYERS jostle YELLING ALL AT ONCE.  T STENOGRAPHER looks up, helpless.
The MAYOR, COMMISSIONER LOEB, and Gordon look up as Dent  enters.
DENT!  What was that circus?!
I asked Gordon to make some arrests.
(looks at report) Five hundred and-
Forty-nine, sir.
Gordon nods at Dent, approving.  Dent grins back.
549 criminals at once?!  How did you  convince Surrillo to hear this farce?
She shares my enthusiasm for justice.   After all, she is a judge.
Even if you blow enough smoke to get  convictions out of Surrillo, you'll  set a new record at appeals for  quickest kick in the ass.

It won't matter.  The head guys make  bail, sure... but the mid-level guys,  they can't, and they can't afford to  be off the streets long enough for  trial and appeal.  They'll cut deals  that include some jail time.  Think  of all you could do with 18 months  of clean streets.
The Mayor waves Gordon and Loeb out.

The public likes you, Dent.  That's  the only reason this might fly.  But  that means it's on you.  They're all  coming after you, now.  Not just the  mob... politicians, journalists,  cops-anyone whose wallet's about to  get lighter.  Are you up to it? (Dent smiles) You better be.  They get anything on  you... those criminals will be back  on the streets...
The Mayor turns to look out of the window.  Quiet.
Followed swiftly by you and me-
BANG!  A DARK SHAPE CRACKS THE GLASS in front of the Mayo nose.  Dent rushes to the window, looks out...
PEDESTRIANS look up, someone SCREAMS, someone POINTS- fiv stories up... SWINGING from a FLAGPOLE... BATMAN.  HANGING BY HIS NECK.  DEAD.  His mouth roughly  painted in a DEMONIC CLOWN SMILE.

"Batman" is lowered from the flagpole.  The same fake Bat we saw earlier.  Pinned to his chest by a KNIFE, a PLAYIN CARD.  A Joker.  Gordon moves closer to the body.  The ca has writing on it: WILL THE REAL BATMAN PLEASE STAND UP?
Wayne comes into the living room, excited.  Alfred is  supervising party arrangements.
How's it going?
I think your fundraiser will be a  great success, sir.
And why do you think I wanted to  hold a party for Harvey Dent?
I assumed it was your usual reason  for socialising beyond myself and  the scum of Gotham's underbelly: to  try and impress Miss Dawes.
Very droll.  But very wrong.  Actually  it's Dent.  You see-
Wayne trails off as he spots something  on the television: the Batman HANGING  as from a NEWS CAMERA, framed by a  graphic that reads 'BATMAN DEAD?'  .  Image cuts to Engel in the studio.
...Police released video footage  found concealed on the body.   Sensitive viewers be aware: it is  disturbing.
The image cuts to a BLINDFOLDED MAN, wearing a makeshift  Batman costume- face bruised and bloody.  In some kind of bright, fluorescent-lit room.
Tell them your name.
(weak) Brian Douglas.
Are you the real Batman?
No.
Why do you dress up like him?
He's a symbol... that we don't have  to be afraid of scum like you...
But you do, Brian.  You really do.   You think the Batman's helped Gotham?
Brian nods uncertainly...
Look at me. (Brian looks down) LOOK AT ME!
Brian looks up- the camera swings into the face of the Jo in CHALK-WHITE makeup, RED SMEAR of lipstick on his SCARS

This is how crazy Batman's made  Gotham.  You want order in Gotham?   Batman has to go.  So... (leans in) Batman must take off his mask, and  turn himself in.  Every day he  doesn't... people will die.  Starting  tonight.  I'm a man of my word.
The tape cuts to STATIC. Wayne turns to Alfred.  Silent.
Dent and Rachel get off the lift.  Dent stands in awe of penthouse and its guests.
Now I've seen it all: Harvey Dent,  scourge of the underworld, scared  stiff by the trust fund brigade.
Rachel spots someone and darts off-
Rachel-
A little liquid courage, Mr. Dent?
Dent turns to see Alfred with drinks on a silver tray.
Thanks.  Alfred, right?
Yes, sir.
Rachel talks about you all the time.   You've known her her whole life?
Not yet, sir.
(smiles, surveys crowd) Any psychotic ex-boyfriends I should  be aware of?
Oh, you have no idea.
Alfred leaves Dent standing there, puzzled.  The crowd RE as a LOUD ROAR drowns conversation... Dent looks out-
Wayne's CHOPPER touches down.  He spills out with a clutc of SUPERMODELS...
Wayne and the supermodels come out of the helipad elevato
Sorry, I'm late- glad you started  without me!  Where's Rachel?!
Rachel cringes slightly.  Wayne spots her.
Rachel Dawes- my oldest friend.   When she told me she was dating Harvey  Dent, I had one thing to say... the  guy from those god-awful campaign  commercials?
Laughter.  Dent shifts, embarrassed.

II Believe in Harvey Dent.' Nice  slogan, Harvey.  Certainly caught  Rachel's attention.  But then I  started paying attention to Harvey,  and all he's been doing as our new  D.A., and you know what?  I believe  in Harvey Dent.  On his watch, Gotham  can feel a little safer.  A little  more optimistic.  So get out your  checkbooks and let's make sure that  he stays right where all of Gotham  wants him... (raises his glass) All except Gotham's criminals, of  course.  To the face of Gotham's  bright future- Harvey Dent.
Dent smiles accepting the toast.
Ramirez catches up to Gordon, holding paperwork.
That Joker card pinned to the body?   Forensics found three sets of D.N.A..
Any matches?
All three.
Gordon STOPS.  Turns to face her.
The D.N.A. belongs to Judge Surrillo,  Harvey Dent and Commissioner Loeb.
The Joker's telling us who he's  targeting- get a unit to Surrillo's  house, tell Wuertz to find Dent- get  them both into protective custody.   Where's the Commissioner?
City hall.
Seal the building.  No one in or out  till I get there.
Wayne walks out to the edge of the balcony and looks over Gotham.  Hears someone behind him- Rachel.
Harvey may not know you well enough  to understand when you're making fun  of him.  But I do.
(shakes his head) I meant every word.
Wayne moves closer to Rachel.  Takes her arm.
The day you once told me about, the  day when Gotham no longer needs  Batman.  It's coming.
Rachel looks at Wayne.  Conflicted.  He moves closer.
You can't ask me to wait for that.
Wayne takes Rachel's arms, looking at her, excited.
It's happening now- Harvey is that  hero.  He locked up half the city's  criminals, and he did it without  wearing a mask.  Gotham needs a hero  with a face.
You can throw a party, Wayne, I'll  give you that.  Thanks again.  Mind  if I borrow Rachel?
Rachel glances back at Wayne as she moves to Dent.  Wayne watches them head inside.
Two MEN in suits knock at a Brownstone.  The door is open by Judge Surrillo.  The two Men hold up BADGES.
Gordon enters through a tight police presence at the door
Gordon enters to find Loeb, flanked by armed cops.
Gordon, what are you playing at?
Gordon checks the window.  Turns to his men.
We're secure.  I want a floor-by- floor search of the entire building. (turns to Loeb) I'm sorry, sir.  We believe the Joker  has made a threat against your life.
Gordon, you're unlikely to discover  this for yourself, so take my word-  the Police Commissioner earns a lot  of threats...
Loeb pulls a bottle of whisky and a tumbler from a drawer
I found the appropriate response to  these situations a long time ago...
The second man is waiting by the Judge's car.
Gordon wants me to go right now?
These are dangerous people, Judge.   Even we don't know where you're going.
He hands Surrillo a sealed envelope.  Opens the car door.
Get in, then open the envelope.   It'll tell you where you're headed.

Surrillo climbs in.  Watches them drive away.  She opens envelope- pulls out a sheet of paper.  One word on it: 'UP'. Surrillo's car EXPLODES, heaving the car upwards on a  FIREBALL. A PASSERBY is thrown to the ground.  After a moment, BURN DEBRIS flutters down on him.  PLAYING CARDS.  JOKERS.
Loeb pours himself a glass of whisky.
You get to explain to my wife why  I'm late for dinner, Lieutenant.
Sir, the Joker card had a trace of  your D.N.A. on it-
A bang at the door.  Gordon pulls his weapon, then opens
Just the normal number of bad guys  in the building- and they're all  city employees.  Here's a list.
How'd they get my D.N.A.?
Gordon looks at Stephens's list.
Somebody with access to your house  or office must've lifted a tissue or  a glass...
Gordon, realizing, spins around-
Wait-
But Loeb is already CHOKING- he DROPS his tumbler onto th desk- the spilled whiskey is SMOKING, eating into the woo
Get a medic!
Loeb COLLAPSES.
Dent pulls Rachel into the kitchen, away from the crowd.
You cannot leave me on my own with  these people.
The whole mob's after you and you're  worried about these guys?
Compared to this, the mob doesn't  scare me.  Although, I will say:  them gunning for you makes you see  things clearly.
Oh, yeah?
Yeah.  It makes you think about what  you couldn't stand losing.  And who  you want to spend the rest of your  life with...
Rachel looks at Dent.  Smiles.
The rest of your life, huh?  That's  a pretty big commitment.
Not if the mob has their way.
Don't.
Okay.  Let's be serious.  What's  your answer?
Rachel looks at him.
I don't have an answer.
Half the guests are on their cell phones.  An ASSISTANT D turns to his COLLEAGUE.
Surrillo and Loeb?

There is a KNOCK at the front door.  Alfred opens it- fin Detective Wuertz, who holds up his badge.  Alfred beckons him in- there is a SHOTGUN at the back of his head held b The Joker- purple suit, make up.  With friends.  The Joke SMASHES Wuertz over the head- steps over him, RACKING the shotgun.
Good evening.  We're the  entertainment.
Rachel is looking at Dent.  Torn.
I guess no answer isn't "no".
I'm sorry, Harvey.  I just...
It's someone else, isn't it?
Wayne is moving up behind him.  Fast-
Just tell me it's not Wayne.  The  guy's a complete-
Rachel's eyes go wide as Wayne puts Dent in a SLEEPER HOL
What are you doing?!
Dent SLUMPS, unconscious in Wayne's arms.
They've come for him.
From the main room- A SHOTGUN BLAST followed by SCREAMS. Wayne stuffs Dent in a closet- puts a mop through the han Rushes past Rachel-
Stay hidden.
The Joker and his THUGS pour into the room, weapons raise
A THUG appears in front of Wayne, toting a shotgun.
Hands up, pretty boy.

Wayne FLIPS the shotgun around in the man's hands- uses i as a fulcrum to SNAP his forearm- SMASHES him in the jaw  with the stock without breaking step, field stripping the shotgun and tossing the pieces in different directions.
The Joker moves through the terrified guests.  Smiling.
I only have one question: where is  Harvey Dent? (silence) I'll settle for his loved ones...
A distinguished Gentleman steps into the Joker's path.
We're not intimidated by thugs.
The Joker stops.  Stares at the man.  SMILES AFFECTIONATE
You know, you remind me of my father. (GRABS him) I hated my father.
The Joker has his blade in the Gentleman's mouth.
Stop!
The Joker drops the Gentleman.  Turns to Rachel.

Hello, beautiful.  You must be  Harvey's squeeze. (runs his knife across  her cheek) And you are beautiful.  You look  nervous- it's the scars isn't it?   Wanna know how I got them?  I had a  wife, beautiful like you.  Who tells  me I worry too much.  Who says I  need to smile more.  Who gambles.   And gets in deep with the sharks.

One day they carve her face, and  we've got no money for surgeries.   She can't take it. (presses knife into  her cheek) I just want to see her smile again.   I just want her to know I don't care  about the scars.  So I put a razor  in my mouth and do this to myself...  And you know what? (starts laughing) She can't stand the sight of me... (or crying) She leaves!  See, now I see the funny  side.  Now I'm always smiling.
Wayne walks in.  A COUPLE are hastily putting themselves  back together, alerted by the noise.
What's going on out there, Wayne?
Wayne doesn't answer.  He walks into a closet and pulls a FALSE WALL.  Wayne steps into the safe room.
Thank god- you've got a panic room.
The door SLAMS shut and seals with a HISS.
Wait!  You can't-
You've got to be kidding me.
The Joker raises his knife from Rachel's cheek.  She SLUG him.  He smiles.
A little fight in you.  I like that.
Then you're going to love me.

The Joker turns.  Batman catches him with a BLOW, spins h down and DISARMS him- the Joker's men jump him- Batman ta them out two at a time- DISARMING thugs- BREAKING forearm the Joker CLICKS a BLADE from the toe of his shoe and KIC JABBING BETWEEN THE PLATES OF ARMOR covering Batman's rib
Batman HURLS the Joker across the room.  One of the Joker men LUNGES- Batman lays him out cold. The Joker has another knife pressed to Rachel's neck.
Drop the knife.
Sure.  Just take off your mask and  show us all who you are...
Rachel shakes her head at Batman.  The Joker raises his  shotgun to the side and BLOWS OUT the pane of glass next him.  The Joker dangles Rachel out the window.
Let her go.
(laughs) Very poor choice of words...
He lets her DROP- Rachel falls onto a SLOPING GLASS ROOF- sliding towards the edge.  Batman DIVES after her-
They DROP- Batman FIRES his grapple, SNAGGING Rachel's an activates one wing of his cape- They SPIN and SLOW- Batma envelopes Rachel- they SLAM into the hood of a passing ta
The DRIVER SCREAMS as Batman and Rachel hit the roof- ROL down the windshield- onto the pavement.  Alive.
The Joker looks back as his car SPEEDS away.  He's breath hard, EXHILARATED.  He touches the blood running down his sweaty white makeup.  SMACKS the back of the driver's sea
What do we do about Dent?
I'm a man of my word.
Rachel opens her eyes.
Are you alright?
Let's not do that again, okay? (looks around) Is Harvey-?
He's safe.
Rachel lies back, breathing.  Looks up at Batman.
Thank you.
STEPHENS is talking to Gordon, subdued.
Jim, it's over.
As long as they don't get to Lau,  we've cut off their funds.
But the prosecution's over.
No-one's standing up in front of a  Judge while judges and police  commissioners are getting blown away.
What about Dent?
If he's got any sense, Dent's halfway  to Mexico by now.
The door BURSTS OPEN.  Dent.  Fire in his eyes.
So where do you keep your trash?
Gordon looks at Dent.  Impressed.

location: SPECIAL HOLDING AREA, MCU, GOTHAM CENTRAL

text: Lau looks up as Dent walks in, holding a bullet proof ves
You're due in court- I need you alive  long enough to get you on the record.
No way.  You can't protect me- you  can't even protect yourselves.
Dent THROWS the heavy vest at Lau.
Refuse to cooperate on the stand-  you won't be coming back here- you'll  go to county.  How long do you  calculate you'll last in there?
Wayne sits at his video screens- they all play the Joker' video with different IMAGE TREATMENTS and SOUND TUNINGS. Wayne turns to Alfred.  Indicates the screens.
Targeting me won't get their money  back.  I knew the mob wouldn't go  down without a fight, but this is  different.  They've crossed a line.
You crossed it first, sir.  You've  hammered them, squeezed them to the  point of desperation.  And now, in  their desperation they've turned to  a man they don't fully understand.
Wayne gets up from his monitors, raises the bat-cabinet.
Criminals aren't complicated, Alfred.   We just have to figure out what he's  after.

Respectfully, Master Wayne, perhaps  this is a man you don't fully  understand, either. (looks at Wayne) I was in Burma.  A long time ago.   My friends and I were working for  the local government.  They were  trying to buy the loyalty of tribal  leaders, bribing them with precious  stones.  But their caravans were  being raided in a forest north of  Rangoon by a bandit.  We were asked  to take care of the problem, so we  started looking for the stones.
But after six months, we couldn't  find anyone who had traded with him.
What were you missing?
One day I found a child playing with  a ruby as big as a tangerine. (shrugs) The bandit had been throwing the  stones away.
So why was he stealing them?

Because he thought it was good sport.   Because some men aren't looking for  anything logical, like money... they  can't be bought, bullied, reasoned  or negotiated with. (grave) Some men just want to watch the world  burn.
Wayne stares at Alfred.  Reaches for the bat-suit.

MOVING over the city we hear myriad RADIO CALLS going out over the ether.  CLOSE IN on a lonely figure on top of a  skyscraper.  The Batman.  Listening with his million doll earpieces.  From the babble, ONE VOICE EMERGES.
Your name, sir.  Please state-
8th at orchard.  You'll find Harvey  Dent there.
An UNMARKED and a SQUAD CAR screech to a halt.  Gordon an Ramirez get out, lead two UNIFORMS into the building.
The door SMASHES OPEN, Gordon- gun drawn- takes in the sc TWO DEAD MEN sitting at the kitchen table.  They each hav HAND OF CARDS, as if in the middle of a game.  ALL JOKERS
Gordon and Ramirez STARE at the CRUDE LEERS carved into t faces.  Their DRIVERS LICENSES are pinned to their chests
Check the names.
(checks licenses) Patrick Harvey.  Richard Dent...
Harvey Dent.
I need ten minutes with the scene  before your men contaminate it.
Us contaminate it?  It's because of  you that these guys are dead in the  first place-
Ramirez.
She stands down.  Batman moves past the bodies to the wal Finds an embedded stray bullet.  He pulls a SAWING DEVICE from his belt- THRUSTS it into the wall and starts cuttin around the bullet.
That's brick- you're gonna try and  take ballistics off a shattered  bullet?
No.  Fingerprints.
Ramirez looks at Gordon.  Is he serious?  Gordon points-
Whatever you're gonna do, do it fast,  'cos we know his next target...
Batman looks- a campaign poster: RE-ELECT MAYOR GARCIA. Mayor's image has a MANIC CLOWN'S GRIN and "HA,HA,HA".
Fox is at his desk.  Reese enters.
What can I do for you, Mr. Reese?
You asked me to do the diligence on  the L.S.I. Holdings deal again.  I  found irregularities.
Their CEO is in police custody.
Not with their numbers.  With yours.   A whole division of Wayne Industries  disappeared, overnight.  So I went  down to the archives and started  pulling old files.
He pulls out a folded blueprint.  Slides it across the de
My kids love the Batman.  I thought  he was pretty cool, too.  Out there,  kicking some ass.
Fox picks up the piece of paper.  Unfolds it.  It's an ol BLUEPRINT.  The image is unmistakable: THE TUMBLER.
Changes things when you know it's  just a rich kid playing dress up.
Reese points to the approval box in the corner of the pag

Your project.  Don't tell me you  didn't recognize your baby pancaking  cop cars on the evening news.  Now  you're getting sloppy.  Applied  Sciences was a small, dead department-  who'd notice?  But now you've got  the entire R and D department burning  cash, claiming it's related to cell  phones for the army.  What are you  building him now?  A rocket ship?  I  want ten million a year.  For the  rest of my life.
Fox looks at him.  Even.  Folds up the blueprint.
Let me get this straight.  You think  that your client, one of the  wealthiest and most powerful men in  the world, is secretly a vigilante  who spends his nights beating
criminals to a pulp with his bare  hands... (deadpan) And now your plan is to blackmail  this person?
Reese stares at Fox.  Who smiles.  And slides the bluepri across the desk.
Good luck.
Reese looks at it.  Then at Fox.  Swallows.  Slides it ba

Wayne hands Alfred a RIFLE BULLET scribed with a GRID.  H slots it into a clip, then loads it into a COMPUTER CONTR GATTLING GUN.  He puts on ear protectors.  Hits a button. The rifle WHIRS to life- dollying sideways, BLASTING BULL into a series of identical BRICK WALL SAMPLES.
I'm not sure you made it loud enough,  sir.

As the wall samples still smoke, Wayne steps up, carrying the sample from the crime scene.  Comparing its spread to the new samples, he selects two and carries them to an X- SCANNER. The machine gives the samples a 3-axis scan- HI-RES 3-D I of the bullet fragment arrays come up on the screen...
The same image of the bullet fragment on a screen.  Fox h a key and the computer 'reassembles' the bullets accordin to the identifying grid on each fragment.
Here's your original scan...
A bullet fragment array pops on  screen.
Here's it reverse-engineered...
Fox hits a button and the unmarked bullet fragments are  reassembled.  Wayne spins the roughly-shaped bullet puzzl
And here's a thumb print.
Fox looks at the screen, impressed.  Thinks.
I'll make you a copy. (troubled) Mr. Wayne, did you reassign R and D?
Yes.  Government telecommunications  project.
I wasn't aware we had any new  government contracts.  Can you-
Lucius.  I'm playing this one pretty  close to the chest.
Fair enough.
Fox looks at Wayne as he leaves.  Uneasy.
Wayne examines the fingerprint-
I've run it through all the databases  and came up with four possibles.
Wayne gets up to let Alfred sit.
Cross-reference the addresses.  Look  for Parkside and around.
Wayne opens a HYDRAULIC DOOR, revealing a gleaming MV AUG BRUTALE.  As he moves the bike onto the lift...
Got one.  Melvin White, aggravated  assault, moved to Arkham twice- 1502  Randolph Apartments, just off State-
Overlooking the parade.
Wayne and the bike rise on the lift.
The avenue has been blocked off.  Onlookers line the  sidewalks.  POLICE march past in dress uniform.  Engel do a stand-up on the sidewalk.
With no word from the Batman- even  as they mourn Commissioner Loeb,  these cops have to be wondering if  the Joker is going to make good on  his threat to kill the Mayor today...
On the buildings above, POLICE SNIPERS scan the crowd. Gordon keys his radio-
How's it looking up top?
We're tight.  But frankly... there's  a lot of windows up here.
Gordon looks up at the myriad buildings overlooking the  podium.
Wayne maneuvers the Ducati through the traffic.  He pulls near a parade barricade- dismounts and slips into an alle
Some of the building's hard-luck TENANTS eye Wayne as he  counts doors down the hallway.  He finds 1502...
A SEA OF POLICE fills the Avenue.  In the center, three  grieving families and an HONOR GUARD.  The Mayor at the  podium.  Gordon behind.  Dent is seated with Rachel.
...and as we recognize the sacrifice  of these officers, we must remember  that vigilance is the price of safety.
Wayne enters: EIGHT MEN IN UNDERSHIRTS, bound, gagged,  blindfolded.  A SNIPER SCOPE on a tripod at the window. Wayne moves to the first man, RIPS the tape from his mout
(breathing hard) Took... they took our guns, our  uniforms...
Gordon scans the crowd.  The Mayor wraps up- the Honor Gu steps forward, raises weapons...
A POLICE SNIPER scans the windows of the tenement...
Wayne RACES to the window, looks through the SCOPE to see

THE HONOR GUARD TURN THEIR WEAPONS ON THE MAYOR.  One SMI flesh-colored makeup over his scars.  THE JOKER. Gordon LEAPS FORWARD- they FIRE- GORDON TAKES SHOTS TO TH BACK as he SLAMS the Mayor to the ground-
The Police Sniper SPOTS Wayne at the window- SHOOTS
Wayne DUCKS as SHOTS erupt around the window-
PANDEMONIUM erupts-One of the honor guard is TAGGED IN TH LEG- GOES DOWN.  The others MELT into the CHAOS. On the podium, Stephens rolls Gordon over... he is not mo
CHAOS.  Dent approaches an ambulance sitting in the alley Two cops jump out and run over to their commander.  Dent  steps up into the back.
The Joker's thug sits there.  Handcuffed.  A PARAMEDIC  bandages his leg.  Cops run past, barking orders.
Tell me what you know about the Joker.

The Joker's thug looks at Dent.  Smirks.  Dent looks down Exasperated.  Looks back up at the Joker's Thug.  Spots  something- moves closer- the man's uniform... his name ta OFFICER RACHEL DAWES. Dent, breathing hard, looks around: the paramedic jumps o rushing to help a FALLEN OFFICER.  Dent spies the keys in the ignition.  Jumps into the driver's seat...
Barbara Gordon stands in the doorway, scared.  Stephens a a UNIFORMED OFFICER stand in front of her.
I'm sorry, Barbara.
James Gordon pushes past his mother to look at Stephens. Barbara tries to push him back inside.
Jimmy, go play with your sister...
James stays just inside the door.
I'm sorry.
Barbara stares at Stephens.  Then looks past him.
Are you out there?!  Are you?!
James spots something- Batman, perched in the shadows.
You brought this on us!  This  craziness!  You did!  You brought  this...!
She collapses into Stephens's arms.  Batman hangs his hea
Detectives from MCU stand around the lit bat-signal.
Switch it off- he ain't coming.
He doesn't want to talk to us.  God  help whoever he does want to talk to-
Strobe lights.  Pounding music.  Maroni is in a booth at side with his MISTRESS.  His bodyguards are around the ta
(shouting over music) Can't we go someplace quieter!  We  can't hear each other talk!
I don't wanna hear you talk.
(can't hear) What?!

One of Maroni's Bodyguards DROPS- Maroni looks over- in t strobe lights- Batman SAVAGES his bodyguards- people RUN, TERRIFIED.  Maroni starts to get out of his seat- Batman  LANDS like a panther on the table in front of him-
Rachel moves through the chaotic bullpen at MCU- EYEWITNE civilian and cop are being questioned. Rachel's phone rings.
Harvey, where are you?!
INTERCUT with Dent in an INDISTINCT interior setting.
Where are you?
Where you should be- at Major Crimes  trying to sort through all the-
Rachel, listen to me.  You're not  safe there.
This is Gordon's unit, Harvey-
Gordon's gone, Rachel.
He vouched for these men-
And he's gone.  The Joker's named  you next.
Rachel looks around the bullpen.  Eyeing the detectives.
Rachel, I can't let anything happen  to you.  I love you too much.  Is  there someone, anyone in this city  we can trust?
Bruce.  We can trust Bruce Wayne.
Rachel, I know he's your friend but-
Trust me, Harvey, Bruce's penthouse  is now the safest place in the city.
Okay.  Go straight there.  Don't  tell anyone where you're going.   I'll find you there.
Wider shows us we are-
I love you.
Dent hangs up the phone.  TAPED to a chair in front of De the Joker's Thug, blindfolded.  Dent RIPS off the blindfo
Maroni opens his eyes.  Batman is holding him by the coll
I want the Joker.
(looks down) From one professional to another- if  you're trying to scare someone, pick  a better spot.  From this height the  fall wouldn't kill me.
I'm counting on it.
Batman lets go.  Maroni FALLS.  And SCREAMS.
Maroni NAILS the pavement.  CLUTCHES at his leg, which is badly broken.  Batman FLIES down, landing over him- hauls him up.  Maroni HOLLERS in pain.
Where is he?
Don't know, he found us-
He must have friends.
Friends?  You met this guy?
Someone knows where he is.
Maroni looks up at Batman.  Sneering.

No one's gonna tell you anything-  they're wise to your act- you got  rules... the Joker, he's got no rules.   No one's gonna cross him for you.   You want this guy, you got one way.   And you already know what that is.   Just take off that mask and let him  come find you.
Batman DROPS Maroni.
Or you want to let a couple more  people get killed while you make up  your mind?
Dent shows the Joker's Thug a GUN.  Bullets.  Loads the g SHOVES it in his face-
You wanna play games?
Dent PUSHES the gun against the thug's head with REAL MAL Pulls it away and FIRES.  The Thug FLINCHES.
Dent puts the gun barrel against the thug's temple-
(rattled) You wouldn't...
And pulls his lucky coin out of his pocket.
No.  I wouldn't.  That's why I'm not  going to leave it up to me. (shows him coin) Heads- you get to keep your head.   Tails... not so lucky.  So, you want  to tell me about the Joker?

The Thug, scared, says nothing.  Dent FLICKS the coin int the air.  SLAPS it onto the back of his gun hand (aiming  with wrist horizontal).  Dent shows him the coin.  Heads. The Thug exhales, SHAKING.
Go again?
(sobbing) I don't know anything!
You're not playing the odds, friend.
Dent tosses the coin again.  This time IT DOESN'T LAND.   Dent Looks up.  Batman is there.
You'd leave a man's life to chance?
Not exactly.
His name's Schiff, Thomas.  He's a  paranoid schizophrenic, a former  patient at Arkham.  The kind of mind  the Joker attracts.
Batman moves away from Schiff.
What do expect to learn from him?
Dent is shivering with frustration.
The Joker killed Gordon- and, and  Loeb.  He's going to kill Rachel...

You're the symbol of hope that I  could never be.  Your stand against  organized crime is the first  legitimate ray of light in Gotham  for decades.  If anyone saw this,  everything would be undone- all the  criminals you got off the streets  would be released.  And Jim Gordon  will have died for nothing.
Batman hands Dent his lucky coin.
You're going to call a press  conference.  Tomorrow morning.
Why?
No one else will die because of me.   Gotham is in your hands, now.
You can't!  You can't give in!
But Batman is gone.
Rachel watches Gotham through the window.  Wayne enters.
Harvey called.  He says Batman is  going to turn himself in.
I have no choice.
You honestly think it's going to  stop the Joker from killing?
Perhaps not.  But I've got enough  blood on my hands.  I've seen, now,  what I would have to become to stop  men like him.
Rachel looks at Wayne.  She cannot help him.
You once told me that if the day  came when I was finished...
Wayne moves towards her.
We'd be together.
Bruce, don't make me your one hope  for a normal life-
Wayne takes her in his arms.
But did you mean it?
Yes.
They kiss.  Then separate.  She looks sadly into his eyes
But they won't let us be together  after you turn yourself in.
Wayne nods.  Leaves.  She watches him go.
Alfred shovels DOCUMENTS into an incinerator- blueprints, designs, files.  He pauses, looking down at a book.
Even the logs?
Anything that could lead back to  Lucius or Rachel.
Alfred tosses the book onto the fire.  STARES at Wayne.
People are dying, Alfred.  What would  you have me do?
Alfred looks into Wayne's eyes with a fearsome gaze.
Endure, Master Wayne.  Take it.   They'll hate you for it, but that's  the point of Batman... he can be the  outcast.  He can make the choice no  one else can face.  The right choice.
Wayne shakes his head.
Today I've found out what Batman  can't do.  He can't endure this. (rueful smile) Today you get to say II told you  so'.
Today, I don't want to. (beat) Although I did bloody tell you.
Wayne sinks the Bat-suit, Alfred closes the incinerator. They head for the lift.
I suppose they'll lock me up as well.   Your accomplice.
Accomplice?  I'm going to tell them  the whole thing was your idea.
They power down, leaving the Bat-bunker in darkness.
A capacity crowd of REPORTERS, COPS, and PUBLIC.  Dent is the podium.  Wayne sits in the crowd.

Ladies and Gentlemen, thank you for  coming.  I've called this press  conference for two reasons.  Firstly,  to assure the citizens of Gotham  that everything that can be done  over the Joker killing is being done.   Secondly, because the Batman has  offered to turn himself in-
The crowd REACTS
So where is he?!
But first.  Let's consider the  situation: should we give in to this  terrorist's demands?  Do we really  think that-
You'd rather protect an outlaw  vigilante than the lives of citizens?!
The crowd noisily assents.  Dent calmly motions quiet.
The Batman is an outlaw...
Rachel is watching the press conference on TV.
But that's not why we're demanding  he turn himself in.  We're doing it  because we're scared.  We've been  happy to let Batman clean up our Streets for us until now-
Things are worse than ever!
Wayne looks at the Heckler.  At the angry crowd.  Dent le over the podium.  Impassioned.

Yes.  They are.  But the night is  darkest just before the dawn.  And I  promise you, the dawn is coming. (the crowd quiets) One day, the Batman will have to  answer for the laws he's broken- but  to us, not to this madman.
The crowd seems moved by his words, then, a CHANT-
NO MORE DEAD COPS!!
Appreciative noise.
WHERE IS THE BATMAN?
People take up the chant.  Dent has lost them.  He knows
So be it. (turns to officers) Take the Batman into custody.
At this, a HUSH DESCENDS.  Wayne is sitting towards the b
Hungry eyes scan the room.  Wayne starts to rise... DENT

head_text.subj: OFFERS HIS OWN WRISTS TO THE OFFICERS

text: I am the Batman.
A beat.  Wayne stares.
Rachel STARES as Dent is arrested on TV.  Appalled.
Rachel comes up to Alfred.  Upset.
Why is he letting Harvey do this,  Alfred?
I don't know.  He went down to the  press conference-
And just stood by?!
Perhaps both Bruce and Mr. Dent  believe that Batman stands for  something more important than a  terrorist's whims, Miss Dawes, even  if everyone hates him for it.
That's the sacrifice he's making- to  not be a hero.  To be something more.
Well, you're right about one thing-  letting Harvey take the fall is not  heroic.
Rachel holds out an ENVELOPE.
You know Bruce best, Alfred... give  it to him when the time is right.
How will I know?
It's not sealed.
Alfred takes the envelope.  Rachel gives him a kiss.
Goodbye, Alfred.
Goodbye, Rachel.
A Detective unlocks the cell and lets Rachel inside.
I'm sorry, I didn't have time to  talk this through with you.
Don't offer yourself as bait, Harvey.
They're transferring me to central  holding.  This is the Joker's chance,  and when he attacks, Batman will  take him down.
No.  This is too dangerous-
The Detective knocks.  Dent rises.
Detectives stare at Dent as he is led, shackled, to the  waiting CONVOY.  Stephens begins CLAPPING- a handful join in, but most remain silent.  Rachel follows him to the ba of an armored vehicle.
He's using you as bait- but he doesn't  know if he can get the Joker- he's  failed so far.
How do you know what he's thinking?
(beat) I just do, okay?  Harvey, this isn't  just about you, what about all the  people counting on you to turn this  city around?  Tell everyone the truth-
Dent kisses her.  Pulls out his LUCKY COIN-
Heads I go through with it.
This is your life... you don't leave  something like this to chance...
