Dent tosses it at her- Rachel catches it.  Looks.  Heads.
(sincere) I'm not.
She turns it over: IT IS DOUBLE-HEADED.  She looks up- th DOORS CLOSE on his smile.  She shakes her head.  Torn.
You make your own luck.
As SWATS file into the back of the support vehicles-
We get this guy to County and he's  their problem.  The streets along  your route will be cleared.  The  convoy stops FOR NO REASON...
A Swat with a shotgun climbs into the cab.  Pulls on his  mask.  Looks over at the DRIVER, who's already wearing hi
Hope you've got some moves.
The convoy ROCKETS past a roadblock.
The Swats are staring at Dent, fascinated.  He smiles.
An Officer holding up traffic.  A TRUCK pulls up.
You wait like everybody else, pal.
A SHOTGUN BLAST sends the Officer flying.  A second blast illuminates the shooter's face: the Joker.
The SWAT behind the wheel of the lead black-and-white slo as he sees something burning in the intersection ahead.
Overhead, a police HELICOPTER checks the route, hovering  above a burning FIRE TRUCK, BLOCKING the road.
The Driver is all business.  The radio CRACKLES.
All units, be advised.  All units  will exit down Cheviot west and  proceed north on lower 5th avenue.
Lower 5th?  We'll be like ducks in a  barrel down there.
The convoy disappears down the exit ramp.
The convoy rolls through the subterranean streets.  A GAR TRUCK pulls up behind and casually SWIPES the rear vehicl of the convoy off the road...
Get us out of here!
The Driver NAILS the gas-
The Garbage Truck pushes hard on the armored car, ramming its rear bumper, FORCING it forward.
The Driver watches the Truck fill his rear view.  Shotgun Swat picks up the radio.
We've got company back here-

A SECOND TRUCK SMASHES into the SWAT van at the head of t convoy, SMASHING it through the concrete barriers and INT THE RIVER.  The truck is branded "LAUGHTER" but an "S" ha been sprayed at the front to make "SLAUGHTER" with "HA, H HA" all over the side... The Joker's Truck DODGES between the support columns and  into the oncoming lane- pulls alongside the armored car. The Driver looks over.  The cargo door on the truck slide open.  Inside, the Joker, holding a machine gun. The armored car LOCKS up its brakes, but the garbage truc pushes it forward as the Joker fires- BULLETS slamming in The side of the vehicle-
Dent is calm as the SWATS FLINCH from the bullet indentat
Shotgun SWAT STARES at the Joker.
The Joker drops his machine gun and picks up an RPG.  He  stops- SEES something up ahead, racing towards the second truck- the BATMOBILE.  The Joker stares, fascinated, as-
-THE BATMOBILE PLOWS STRAIGHT INTO THE SECOND TRUCK- the profile car sending the truck UP INTO THE CONCRETE CEILIN the Batmobile carries on through, as the TRUCK DISINTEGRA
The Joker looks back to the batmobile, amused.
Is that him-?
Anyone could be driving that thing- stay on Dent.
The Joker lines up his RPG and prepares to fire-
Shotgun SWAT's eyes go wide at the Joker's weapon- the Dr JAMS the brakes-

The Armored Car CRASHES BACK against the Garbage Truck, BRAKING, SCRAPING, SLOWING just enough- the RPG SLAMS int the SQUAD CAR in front of them and EXPLODES- the armored BURSTS through the fireball and continues.
The Batmobile SPINS around to rejoin the pursuit.
The Joker turns his men to RELOAD his RPG
Do me up-
Turns back- levels his RPG out the window.  Aims.
Batman watches as the Joker prepares to fire.  Several ro of cars separate them.  He toggles the afterburner.
Two small children in the back of the car watch as the  Batmobile ROCKETS overhead.

The Joker steadies the RPG and FIRES- the Batmobile CRASH down into the open space between the two vehicles- taking the hit from the RPG which EXPLODES-  The rear of the Batmobile EXPLODES- SPINNING the FLAMING
SWATS react to the EXPLOSION.  Dent is calm.
The Driver takes a DEBRIS HIT to the head-
The Joker CACKLES with delight as he is THROWN AROUND the rear of the trailer-
Batman WRESTLES the pod controls, SPINNING on the GYRO-
The Batmobile flips over to come to rest in a smoking hea the front end intact, rear wheels scattered across the  roadway.  A small crowd gathers.
The Joker JUMPS down from the truck, still giggling like kid- looks back at the Batmobile's destruction-
Whoever he was... he ain't now.
The Joker YANKS his dead driver out of the cab, JUMPS ove him to take the wheel and pull back onto the roadway.
The armored car pulls ahead, the Joker's truck in hot pur
Shotgun SWAT glances in the rear view mirror, slaps the d
Let's get topside- we need that air  support!
The armored car PULLS onto a RAMP, heading up.  The Joker Truck follows.
People stare at the smoking wreck, inching closer...
Batman adjusts his position.  Hits a button-
Damage catastrophic.  Initiate eject  and self-destruct.
Arm guards GRAB Batman's forearms as EXPLOSIVE BOLTS FIRE all around the pod...
Goodbye.

The crowd JUMPS- PANELS of the front of the car BLOW OUT- The crowd stares, OPEN-MOUTHED, as Batman EMERGES, HOISTE UP AND OUT of the flaming car by the FRONT POD- LEVERING  OVER the FRONT WHEEL... the pod PUSHES the OTHER WHEEL IN FRONT to form a type of MOTORCYCLE- The BAT-POD SHOOTS  FORWARD, bursting free as the Batmobile DETONATES, DYING a MASSIVE FIREBALL... Batman's cape SUCKS TOGETHER, formi a TIGHT PACK on his shoulders, clear of the CHURNING REAR TIRE of the bat-pod...
The armored car races down the street- the CHOPPER dips l
We're back on point- and ready to  give some of their own medicine-
Cop pulls out an ASSAULT RIFLE.  COCKS it-
The Joker FIGHTS with the truck's gearbox, turns to his T
Tee 'em up.
The Thug GRABS his radio.
A Joker Thug in clown mask loads up the cable gun seen in the bank heist.
Another thug loads his own cable gun...
A motorist stares through his rear-view mirror, transfixe as the bat-pod TEARS past.  He YELPS as the bat-pod SMASH the wing mirror from his car.

Batman accelerates, oblivious to the STACCATO of CLEAVED  wing mirrors as the bat-pod RAZORS through traffic- CROSS a BUSY INTERSECTION- The bat-pod CUTS off the crowded low level street, ROARING over into the PARKING LANES-
Batman squeezes his triggers- BLASTING at PARKED CARS, BL them out of the way, literally CANNONING A PATH for the p
The Bat-Pod CANNONS through the glass doors and RACES thr the station/mall- COMMUTERS screaming and diving out of t way- The Bat-Pod races up the stairs and onto the upper street

The Joker's Thugs FIRE THE CABLES ACROSS THE STREET AT SE FLOOR LEVEL... they pull TAUT as the Chopper approaches,  unawares... the Chopper CATCHES on the cables, GOING DOWN a FIERY BALL that BARRELS along the street towards the ar car...
The Driver steers around the flaming wreckage as the Shot
The Bat-pod TEARS down a narrow alley blocked with DUMPST CANNONS the dumpsters to make a path-
The Joker hands the wheel to his man- takes a submachine
Boss?
The Joker looks ahead to see the Bat-pod emerge from the  alley in a cloud of fire, SKIDDING SIDEWAYS IMPOSSIBLY- i
Guess it was him.
The Bat-pod RACES straight at the Joker's truck- FIRES A  HARPOON at the Joker's truck- it IMPACTS low, below the b
The Joker's Thug DUCKS, then comes back up, beaming.
He missed!
Batman SWERVES past the Joker's truck, SLALOMS, wrapping CABLES around a LAMP POST, SPINNING to a halt to watch...

The cable goes TAUT, RIPPING one post from its foundation the TRUCK'S FRONT WHEELS CATCH, FLIPPING IT END OVER END. The Joker crawls from the wreckage.  He jumps over the me and starts waving his pistol at oncoming traffic.  Batman GUNS the bat-pod and rides it up and over the median.
The Driver slows the car, pulls to the side.
What the hell are you doing?
The Joker walks towards the Bat-pod, which SPEEDS towards him.  He is FIRING his gun RANDOMLY at the oncoming traff
Hit me.  Come on.  Hit me.

Batman watches as the Joker holds out his arms.  Waiting impact.  There is no room to go around him. Batman LOCKS UP THE BRAKES. The Joker watches as Batman DUMPS the bike, rather than Smashing into him.  Batman SLAMS into the wall. The Joker's thug reach Batman first.  He is unconscious. The first Thug pulls at the mask.  An ELECTRIC SHOCK from the batsuit THROWS him back.  The Joker LAUGHS.  Flicks h switchblade.  Crouches-
Drop it.
Just give me a second.

The gun is COCKED.  The Joker drops the knife.  Sits.  Lo back.  Behind them is the armored car.  The man standing  over him is the Driver.  He pulls off his helmet. It's JIM GORDON.  Back from the dead.
We got you, you son of a bitch.
Dent looks up as the door swings open to reveal Gordon.   Dent GRINS.
Lieutenant, you do like to play it  pretty close to the chest...
We got him, Harvey.
Dent nods.  Respect in his eyes.  They shake hands.

A small army of cops have sealed off the roadway.  Gordon pulls away in the squad car containing the Joker. REPORTERS clamor for an interview with Dent, who is being helped out of the van by the SWATS.  Ramirez pushes throu the pack, shoving reporters aside.
Let him be!  He's been through enough-
Dent follows Ramirez to a squad car- Wuertz is in the dri seat.  Dent smiles at Ramirez as she opens the rear door.
Thanks, detective- I've got a date  with a pretty upset fiancГ©e.
I figured, counselor.
Ramirez shuts the door on Dent.  Signals Wuertz to pull o

The Joker sits in a holding cage.  His makeup has run, hi clothes a mess- but his calm lends him an odd dignity.  C SMASH their night sticks against the bars near the Joker' head.  The Joker does not flinch.
Stand away!  All of you.  I don't  want anything for his mob lawyer to  use, understand?  Handle this guy  like he's made of glass.
The Mayor walks in.  Shakes Gordon's hand.
Back from the dead.
I couldn't chance my family's safety.
The Mayor looks over at the Joker in his cage.
What do we got?
Nothing.  No matches on prints, DNA,  dental.  Clothing is custom, no  labels.  Nothing in his pockets but  knives and lint.  No name, no other  alias... nothing.

Go home, Gordon.  The clown'll keep  till morning.  Get some rest- you're  going to need it.  Tomorrow, you  take the big job. (off look) You don't have any say in the matter. (louder, for all) Commissioner Gordon.
The cops in M.C.U. start CHEERING.
Gordon rings the bell.  Barbara answers it, dressed in bl
Couldn't tell you.  I couldn't risk-
She SLAPS Gordon.  He grabs her, holds her tight as she s
The Joker's men are processed.  In the harsh light, the m look a little ridiculous in their clown make-up.  DETECTI MURPHY turns to Stephens.
Look at these ugly bastards.
One of the men, walks over, clutching at his belly.
I don't feel good.
You're a cop killer.  You're lucky  to be feeling anything below the  neck.
Alone in his cage, the Joker smiles at this.
Gordon crouches by his son's beside.  He reaches out to t James Jr's cheek.  James's eyes open.  Staring at his dad if still dreaming.
(whispers) Did Batman save you, dad?
Gordon looks at his son.  A little pride seeps in.
Actually, this time I saved him.
Gordon's phone rings-
Gordon PUSHES through the swarm of detectives crowded int the observation room.  The Joker can be seen through the  glass, as well as on a large MONITOR.  Sitting there.  Ca
Has he said anything, yet?
Ramirez shakes her head.  Gordon PUSHES through a door...
The Joker, in near darkness.  Gordon walks in.  Sits.
Evening, Commissioner.
Harvey Dent never made it home.
Of course not.
What have you done with him?
(laughs) Me?  I was right here.
Who did you leave him with?  Your  people?  Assuming, of course, that  they are your people not Maroni's... (off look) Does it depress you, Lieutenant, to  know how alone you are?
Gordon can't help glancing at the mounted CAMERA.
Does it make you feel responsible  for Harvey Dent's current predicament?
Where is he?
What time is it?
What difference does that make?
Depending on the time, he might be  in one spot. (smiles) Or several.
Gordon stands.  Moves to the Joker.  Undoes his handcuffs
If we're going to play games, I'm  going to need a cup of coffee.
The good cop, bad cop routine?
Gordon pauses, hand on the doorknob.
Not exactly.

Gordon steps out.  The overhead lights COME ON.  BATMAN I BEHIND HIM.  The Joker BLINKS in the HARSH WHITE LIGHT. WHAM!  The Joker's face HITS the table- comes up for air- CRACK!  CRACK!  To the head.  Batman is in front of him. The Joker stares, fascinated.  Bleeding.
Never start with the head... victim  gets fuzzy.  Can't feel the next-
CRACK!  Batman's fist SMACKS down on the Joker's fingers.
(calm) See?
You wanted me.  Here I am.
I wanted to see what you'd do.  And  you didn't disappoint... (laughs) You let five people die.  Then you  let Dent take your place.  Even to a  guy like me... that's cold-
Where's Dent?
Those mob fools want you gone so  they can get back to the way things  were.  But I know the truth- there's  no going back.  You've changed things.   Forever.
Then why do you want to kill me?
The Joker starts LAUGHING.  After a moment he's laughing hard it sounds like SOBBING.
Kill you?  I don't want to kill you.   What would I do without you?  Go  back to ripping off Mob dealers?  No  you... (points) You.  Complete.  Me.
You're garbage who kills for money.
Don't talk like one of them- you're  not, even if you'd like to be.  To  them you're a freak like me... they  just need you right now.
He regards Batman with something approaching pity.
But as soon as they don't, they'll  cast you out like a leper.
The Joker looks into Batman's eyes.  Searching.

Their morals, their code... it's a  bad joke.  Dropped at the first sign  of trouble.  They're only as good as  the world allows them to be.  You'll  see- I'll show you... when the chips  are down, these civilized people...  they'll eat each other. (grins) See, I'm not a monster... I'm just  ahead of the curve.
Batman GRABS the Joker and pulls him upright.
One of the Detectives moves for the door.  Gordon stops h
He's in control.
Batman HOISTS the Joker up by the neck.
Where's Dent?
You have these rules.  And you think  they'll save you.
I have one rule.
Then that's the one you'll have to  break.  To know the truth.
Which is?
(smiles) The only sensible way to live in  this world is without rules.  Tonight  you're going to break your one rule...
Batman leans in to the Joker.
I'm considering it.
There are just minutes left- so,  you'll have to play my little game  if you want to save... (with relish) ...one of them.
Them?
For a while I thought you really  were Dent, the way you threw yourself  after her-
Batman DROPS the Joker- RIPS up a bolted-down chair-
Gordon MOVES for the door-
Batman JAMS the chair under the doorknob- PICKS up the Jo and HURLS him into the two-way glass.  The glass SPIDERS.
The Joker, bleeding from nose and mouth, LAUGHS at Batman
Look at you go... does Harvey know  about you and his-?
The Joker SMASHES into the wall- SLIDES to the floor.  Ba stands over him, a man possessed-
WHERE ARE THEY?!
He GRABS the Joker, holding him close-
Killing is making a choice...
Batman PUNCHES the Joker across the face.  HARD.
WHERE ARE THEY?!
The Joker FEEDS off Batman's anger.  Loving it.
...you choose one life over the other.
Your friend, the district attorney.   Or his blushing bride-to-be.
Batman PUNCHES the Joker again.  The Joker LAUGHS.

You have nothing.  Nothing to threaten  me with.  Nothing to do with all  your strength... (spits a tooth) But don't worry, I'm going to tell  you where they are.  Both of them,  and that's the point- you'll have to  choose.
The Batman stares at the Joker...
He's at 250 52nd Boulevard.  And  she's on avenue X at Cicero.
Batman DROPS him.
Batman RACES past Gordon.
Which one are you-
Dent knew the risks.
Gordon looks back- the Joker is bloody, but grinning.
Several cops see Batman climb onto the bat-pod and TEAR o
Batman SWERVES into oncoming traffic, CHAOS in his wake.
Gordon and his men SCRAMBLE into their cars...
Black.
Can anyone hear me?
Harvey Dent opens his eyes.  He's bound to a chair in a d unfurnished basement apartment.
Rachel?  Rachel is that you?
(sobbing) Harvey.  You're OK.  I thought...
Her voice is coming from a speakerphone on the floor.
It's OK, Rachel.  Everything's going  to be just fine.
He looks around.  Behind him, metal BARRELS, hooked up to car battery, with a TIMER counting down: five minutes.
The Joker sits, smiling, content.  Stephens guards the do
I want my phone call.
That's nice.
How many of your friends have I  killed?
I'm a twenty year man.  I can tell  the difference between punks who  need a little lesson in manners, and  the freaks like you who would just  enjoy it. (quiet) And you killed six of my friends.
The Fat Thug shuffles to the bars, where a COP stands gua
(agony) Please.  My insides hurt.
Step away from the bars.
The boss said he would make the voices  go away.  He said he would go inside  and replace them with bright lights.   Like Christmas.
That's great.  Please step-
The Fat Thug COLLAPSES.  The Cop grabs his radio.
Rachel is bound to a chair.  Behind her are barrels ident to the ones behind Dent.
Can you move your chair?
No.  Harvey, we don't have much time-
The timer connected to the bomb reads 2.47... 2.46...
Dent DRAGS his chair, inching closer to the barrels.
Look for something to free yourself.
The chair JAMS against a ridge in the floor.  Dent STRAIN to reach the timer.  Inches shy.
They said only one of us was going  to make it.  That they'd let our... (pause) Our friends choose...
Dent strains... THE CHAIR, AND DENT, TOPPLE OVER- KNOCKIN OVER A BARREL.
Harvey?  What's happening?
Dent, one side of his face pressed against the bare floor watches the open barrel SPEW DIESEL FUEL around him-
Nothing.  I'm trying to...
Dent contorts his head to keep from swallowing any.
The bat-pod SKIDS SIDEWAYS, WHEELS FLIPPING as the gyro k Batman upright on the tumbling bike- it comes to rest- gu lined up with a fire exit- BLOWS the door off its hinges- JUMPS off the bike-
Gridlock.  Gordon SWERVES onto the sidewalk.  People SCAT
The Joker sits like a kid kept after class.  He smiles.
You know why I use a knife, Detective?   Guns are too quick.  You don't get  to savor all the little emotions.   See, in their last moments, people  show you who they really are...
Stephens tries hard to ignore him.  It isn't working.
So, in a way, I knew your friends  better than you ever did. (smiles) Would you like to know which of them  were really cowards?
(rolls up sleeves) I know you're going to enjoy this.   But I'm going to enjoy it more.
Stephens PUNCHES the Joker in the gut.
Dent is half submerged in diesel fuel.
Harvey, in case... I want you to  know something...
Dent CHOKES, his emotions overwhelming him.
Don't think like that, Rachel.   They're coming for you.
I know, but I don't want them to...
Rachel looks at the timer.  Ten seconds left.
I don't want to live without you.   Because I do have an answer, and my  answer is yes...
A MEDIC CUTS away the Fat Thug's shirt- his belly has lar INCISION, which has been closed with crude looking STITCH
He's got some kind of... contusion...
A RECTANGULAR SHAPE is visible under the skin above his n
Stephens shuffles out into the room, a piece of BROKEN GL held to his THROAT by the Joker.  Cops draw their weapons
This is my own damn fault.  Just  shoot him.
What do you want?
I want my phone call.
The Detectives look at each other.  One of them pulls out his cell phone.  TOSSES it to the Joker, who begins to di
The Medic gingerly PRESSES the rectangle.  It illuminates soft blue light visible through the skin.
Is that a... phone?
The Joker presses SEND.  At the end of the room, the door the holding area EXPLODES-
Batman SPRINTS down the hall- stops at a door- KICKS it-
Cars PULL UP- Gordon gets out, carrying a fire ax-
Batman KICKS- the door gives- Batman SMASHES it open-
Batman BURSTS through the door- Dent looks up in horror-
NO!  Not me... Why did you come for  me?!
Batman STARES at Dent.  The Joker lied.  The counter hits Seconds.  Batman DRAGS Dent out- Dent FIGHTS to stay-
RACHEL!
Harvey?  Harvey, it's okay...
RACHEL!!!
Gordon, axe in hand, RUNS towards the entrance-
Rachel can hear Dent.  The counter runs out.
(calm) Somewhere-
The BLAST HURLS Gordon backward onto the hood of his car-

head_text.subj: THE ENTIRE WAREHOUSE IS AN ENORMOUS EXPLOSION-

text: Batman wraps his cape around Dent and hurls them both thr the door.  Dent is SCREAMING-
Gordon picks himself up.  The warehouse is an inferno.  H heads for it anyway.  Five of his men have to RESTRAIN HI

A SECOND EXPLOSION- Batman COVERS Dent as the FIREBALL HI them- IGNITING the diesel soaking Dent's left side- he st BURNING.  And stops screaming.  Batman ROLLS Dent on the pavement... Dent SIZZLES.  Silent.

location: SPECIAL HOLDING AREA, MCU, GOTHAM CENTRAL

text: The Joker walks to the bars of another cell.  Grins.
Hello there.
In his cell.  Terrified.  Lau.
Dent is wheeled into an ambulance, bandages held to his f His one visible eye STARES BLANKLY, oblivious to the pani
Gordon watches the fire.  DEBRIS blows across the asphalt Gordon picks up two pieces: SINGED JOKER CARDS.  In place the Joker's face is a PHOTO OF LAU.  A POLICE SERGEANT  approaches.
Dent's alive, Jim.  Just.  But back  at M.C.U.... the Joker's gone...
With Lau? (the Cop nods) The Joker planned to be caught.  He  wanted me to lock him up in M.C.U..
A squad car BLAZES down the street.  The Joker sticks his head out the window like a dog, feeling the wind...
Alfred sits at a table reading the letter from Rachel.
Dear Bruce, I need to explain...
Water.  Smoldering blackness.  The FIRE CREWS extinguish last flames of the devastated building.  A FIREMAN nudges his COLLEAGUE, pointing out something in the devastation.
...I need to be honest and clear.  I'm going to marry Harvey Dent...
Glimpses of Dent's damaged face as SURGEONS surround him.
I love him, I want to spend the rest  of my life with him...
The Firemen watch a statue-like figure amidst the charred ruins.  The Batman.
When I told you that if Gotham no  longer needed Batman we could be  together, I meant it...
Gordon surveys the wreckage of MCU.  The bodies.
But I'm not sure the day will come...
Batman bends to the ground on one knee, his black glove s against the smoldering debris.
...when you no longer need Batman.   I hope it does, and if it does I  will be there...
He spots something.  DENT'S TWO-HEADED COIN.  Blackened,  SCARRED.  Batman turns it over.  The other side is PRISTI
Alfred reads.
...but as your friend.  I'm sorry to  let you down...
Dent, heavily bandaged, hooked up to various machines. Batman stands at the foot of his bed.  Watching.
If you lose your faith in me, please  keep your faith in people...
I'm sorry, Harvey.
Batman puts DENT'S DAMAGED COIN on the bedside table.
Love, now and always, Rachel.
Alfred finishes the letter.  Tears in his eyes, he folds back into its envelope.  Places it on the breakfast tray.
Alfred moves through the silent space, stepping past the  cowl and gauntlets lying on the cold marble.  He approach Wayne, half-undressed, slumped in a chair, watching Gotha
I prepared a little breakfast.
Nothing.  Alfred sets down the tray.  The envelope is pro against the silver teapot.
Very well.
Alfred?
Yes, Master Wayne?
Wayne turns, a desperate look in his eye.
Did I bring this on us?  On her?  I  thought I would inspire good, not  madness-
You have inspired good.  But you  spat in the face of Gotham's criminals-  didn't you think there might be  casualties?  Things were always going  to have to get worse before they got  better.
But Rachel, Alfred...
Rachel believed in what you stood  for.  What we stand for.
Wayne looks up at Alfred.  Alfred picks up the cowl.
Gotham needs you.
Gotham needs its hero.  And I let  the Joker blow him half to hell-
Which is why for now, they'll have  to make do with you.
Alfred hands him the cowl.  Wayne looks at him.
She was going to wait for me.  Dent  doesn't know.  He can never know...
Alfred glances at the envelope.  Takes it off the tray.
What's that?
It can wait.
Alfred puts the envelope in his pocket.
That bandit, in the forest in Burma...  Did you catch him? (Alfred nods) How?
(uneasy) We burned the forest down.
A national guard helicopter ROARS over Gotham General.

Dent.  Bandaged.  Sedated.  Coming up for air.  Sees some on the table: his coin.  He fumbles for it, marvelling at its shiny face.  Remembering. INSERT CUT: RACHEL CATCHES THE COIN. Dent turns the coin over.  The other side is devastated. STARES at the scarred face.  Starts ripping his bandages.
Alfred comes up to Wayne.  Points him to the TV.
You need to see this.
On screen: Engel, in his studio, addresses the camera.
...he's a credible source- an A and  M lawyer for a prestigious  consultancy.  He says he's waited as  long as he can for the Batman to do  the right thing...
The shot cuts to REESE, nodding.
Now he's taking matters into his own  hands.  We'll be live at five with  the true identity of the Batman,  stay with us...
Gordon ENTERS.  Dent STARES to one side.  He looks normal
I'm sorry about Rachel. (nothing) The Doctor says you're in agonizing  pain but you won't accept medication.   That you're refusing skin grafts-
Remember the name you all had for me  when I was at Internal Affairs?   What was it, Gordon?
Harvey, I can't-
SAY IT!
Dent's anger makes Gordon flinch.  He looks away.  Ashame
(small) Two-face.  Harvey two-face.

Dent turns to face Gordon- the left side of Dent's face i DESTROYED- skin blackened and shriveled.  Molars visible. The eye a ball and socket.  Dent manages a small smile wi the good side of his face.
Why should I hide who I am?

I... I know you tried to warn me.   I'm sorry.  Wuertz picked you up-  was he working for them? (nothing) Do you know who picked up Rachel? (nothing) Harvey, I need to know which of my  men I can trust.
Dent looks at Gordon.  Cold.
Why would you listen to me now?
I'm sorry, Harvey.
No.  No you're not.  Not yet.
Gordon takes a last look at Dent.  Then leaves.
Gordon steps out.  Someone is there.  Maroni.  On crutche Gordon stares at him.  Cold.  Maroni shifts, awkward.
This craziness.  This is too much.
You should have thought of that before  you let the clown out of the box.
You want him, I can tell you where  he'll be this afternoon.
The Chechen gets out of his SUV.  Looks at a RUSTED HULK. The Chechen, bodyguards, and dogs, head up the gangplank.
They pass into a huge hold.  In the middle: A BILLION DOL The pile is thirty feet high.  Standing on top- the Joker At his feet, bound, is Lau.  The Chechen laughs.
Like I say- not so crazy as you look.
The Joker jumps from the top, slides down the pile.
I told you- I'm a man of my word. (looks around) Where's the Italian?
The Chechen shrugs.  Pulls out a cigar.  Lights it.
More for us.  What you do with all  your money, Mr. Joker?
The Joker GRABS a can of GASOLINE from his thug.
I'm a man of simple tastes.  I like  gunpowder.  Dynamite...
He is SPLASHING gasoline onto the money.
...gasoline...
The Chechen, FURIOUS, steps forwards.  The Joker turns.   JABS his gun in the Chechen's face.  The Chechen's bodygu REACT.  The Joker's men DRAW on them.
And you know what they have in common?   They're cheap.
You said you were a man of your word.
The Joker PLUCKS the cigar from the Chechen's lips.
I am.
The Joker tosses the cigar at the pile.
I'm only burning my half.
The Chechen watches the money catch fire.
All you care about is money.  This  city deserves a better class of  criminal, and I'm going to give it  to them.  This is my town now.  Tell  your men they work for me.
The Joker crouches down to the Chechen's dogs.  They GROW
They won't work for a freak.
The Joker takes out a knife.  Tosses it to his man.
Cut him up and offer him to his little  Princes.  Let's show him just how  loyal a hungry dog is.
The Joker's men GRAB the Chechen.
It's not about money.  It's about  sending a message...
The Joker watches the towering FLAMES.  Lau screams.
Everything.  Burns.
The Joker pulls out a phone...
Reese has a confident air.  Engel is taking calls.
I wanna how much they're gonna pay  you to say who Batman really is.
That's simply not why I'm doing this.
Caller, you're on the air.
Harvey Dent didn't want us to give  in to this maniac- you think you  know better than him?
Guy's got a point- Dent didn't want  Batman to give himself up, is this  the right thing to do?
If we could talk to Dent now he might  feel differently-
And we wish him a speedy recovery.   God knows we need him, now.  Let's  take another call-
Mr. Reese, what's more valuable: one  life, or a hundred?
I guess it would depend on the life.
OK.  Let's say it's your life.  Is  it worth more than the lives of  several hundred others?
Of course not.
I'm glad you feel that way.  Because  I've put a bomb in one of the city's  hospitals.  It's going off in sixty  minutes unless someone kills you.
Who is this?
Just a concerned citizen- (drops pitch to the
-and regular guy...
Gordon and his men are gearing up to take down the Joker. Detective turns up the TV in the bullpen-

I had a vision.  Of a world without  Batman.  The mob ground out a little  profit and the police tried to shut  them down, one block at a time...  and it was so... boring.  I've had a  change of heart.  I don't want Mr.  Reese spoiling everything, but why  should I have all the fun?  Let's  give someone else a chance...
Reese looks around, twitching.  Sweating.
If Coleman Reese isn't dead in sixty  minutes, then I blow up a hospital.   Of course, you could always kill  yourself, Mr. Reese.  But that would  be the noble thing to do.  And you're  a lawyer.
The line rings off.  Engel is speechless. Gordon turns to the uniform COPS.

Call in every officer- tell them to  head to their nearest hospital and  start evac and search.  Call the  transit authority, school board,  prisons- get every available bus  down to a hospital- the priority is  Gotham General- wheel everybody out  of that place right now- my hunch is  that's where the bomb is.
Why?
That's where Harvey Dent is.
The Uniforms SPRINT off.  Gordon turns to his Detectives.
Where are we going, sir?
On screen: Reese is a deer in the headlights.
To get Reese.
Wayne and Alfred move to the elevator.
I need you plugged in, checking  Gordon's men and their families.
Looking for?
Hospital admissions.
Will you be taking the batpod, sir?
In the middle of the day?  Not very  subtle, Alfred.
The Lamborghini then. (watches Wayne go) Much more subtle.
Wayne's Lamborghini TEARS through downtown.
CHAOS.  PATIENTS and STAFF running around.  COPS and TRAF WARDENS try to manage the evacuation.  The COPS stationed outside Dent's room, look around, unsure-
Sir, are you going to help?!
Two Cops move to help wheel gurneys around the corner.
Gordon and his men escort Reese out of the elevator- Enge follows with a camera crew.  As they approach the glass d Gordon looks out at an angry crowd.
Commissioner?!  You really think  someone would try to-
Gordon SPOTS an OLD MAN raising a PISTOL- Gordon THROWS R to the ground as SHOTS SHATTER the laminated glass of the lobby.  The Crowd SURGES in all directions-
Get the cars around back!
Gordon hauls Reese to the stairwell.
Wayne SLOWS past the chaos outside the television station
I saw O'Brien and Richards...
Alfred types at the computer station.
Nothing on them.  No immediate family  members admitted to a Gotham hospital.
Gordon pulls the shaken Reese down the stairs...
(shaken) They're trying to kill me.
...and into a police VAN...
Gordon throws Reese in the back.  Smiles.
Well, maybe Batman will save you.
The van PEELS out.  Heads onto the streets.
Cops load patients onto BUSES.  A TV van pulls up, Engel his Cameraman jump out.  One of Dent's guards, POLK, look into a SCHOOL BUS.  Turns to the Cop loading it.
Okay, don't put anyone else on. (gets on radio) Davis, I got space, bring him out. (no answer) Davis?
Polk heads back towards the hospital, against the flow.
Wayne trails the police van from a distance.
I saw Burns and Zachary... and a  patrolman I don't know.
Burns is clean... Zachary...
There's at least one I don't know-  send the information to Gordon-
Gordon's phone BEEPS.  He looks at a text: WATCH OUT.  CO WITH RELATIVES IN GOTHAM HOSPITALS- BURKE, RAMIREZ, TILL.
Polk enters the room.  No Davis.  Just a REDHEADED NURSE, back towards him, reading Dent's chart.
Ma'am, we're going to have to move  him, now. (nothing) Ma'am?
The Redhead TURNS- it is the Joker, silenced pistol in ha He FIRES.
The Lamborghini zips around a car to get closer to the va
Gordon is reading his phone: ERIKSON, BERG.  Gordon looks sharply.  Considers the uniformed cop nervously fingering his shotgun.
Berg, isn't it?
The young cop, BERG, looks up.  Sweating.
Commissioner?
You okay, son?
Berg nods.  Looks at his watch.
The Joker draws closer to Dent's bed.  Dent STRAINS at th leather cuffs binding him to the bed.
I don't want there to be any hard  feelings between us, Harvey.
The Joker loosens Dent's restraints.
When you and Rachel were being  abducted I was sitting in Gordon's  cage.  I didn't rig those charges-
Your men.  Your plan.
Do I really look like a guy with a  plan, Harvey?  I don't have a  plan...The mob has plans, the cops  have plans.  You know what I am,  Harvey?
Dent's hand is TREMBLING.

I'm a dog chasing cars... I wouldn't  know what to do with one if I caught  it.  I just do things.  I'm just the  wrench in the gears.  I hate plans.   Yours, theirs, everyone's.  Maroni  has plans.  Gordon has plans.   Schemers trying to control their  worlds.  I'm not a schemer, I show  the schemers how pathetic their  attempts to control things really  are.  So when I say that you and  your girlfriend was nothing personal,  you know I'm telling the truth...
Hands him the pistol.  Dent holds it to the Joker's head.
Wayne ROARS past a line of traffic to settle in a few car back from the police van, sitting at a red light.
Wayne studies the intersection- spots a PICKUP jostling f position on the cross street.
Gordon watches Berg, mentally tracing the trajectory of h shotgun barrel as Berg fiddles with his gun.  Gordon star trying to subtly unholster his own weapon.
I'm gonna need your weapon, son.
Berg looks at Gordon.
What?
Wayne watches the driver of the pickup staring intently a the police van.  Lining it up.
Reese looks from Berg to Gordon.  Berg looks at Gordon,  trembling, the barrel of his gun inching lower in the car
Why?  Because my wife's in hospital?
Yeah.  That would be why.
The Joker leans in, pressing his head to the gun's barrel

It's the schemers who put you where  you are.  You were a schemer.  You  had plans.  Look where it got you.   I just did what I do best- I took  your plan, and I turned it on itself.   Look what I've done to this city  with a few drums of gas and a couple  of bullets.  Nobody panics when the  expected people get killed.  Nobody  panics when things go according to  plan, even if the plan is horrifying. If I tell the press that tomorrow a  gangbanger will get shot, or a  truckload of soldiers will be blown  up, nobody panics.  Because it's all  part of the plan.  But when I say  that one little old mayor will die,  everybody loses their minds!
Introduce a little anarchy, you upset  the established order and everything  becomes chaos.  I'm an agent of chaos.   And you know the thing about chaos,  Harvey?
Dent looks into the Joker's eyes.  Finding meaning.
It's fair.
Dent looks down at the coin in his hands.  Turns it over, feels it's comforting weight.  Shows the Joker the good s
You live.
He turns the coin over.  The flip side is deeply SCARRED.
You die.
The Joker looks at the coin.  Looks at Dent, admiringly.
Now you're talking.
Dent FLICKS the coin into the air.  Catches it.  Looks.
The light turns GREEN.  The police van pulls into the  intersection- the pickup GUNS IT, RACING AT IT...
Wayne FLOORS it, YANKS the wheel to pull up onto the side
Berg licks his lips, nervous.
Mr. Reese?
The pickup BARRELS at the van, FULL TILT- at the last sec Wayne's Lamborghini SLIPS alongside the van- the pickup
As the van JOLTS with the impact Gordon LEAPS forward, PU UP Berg's shotgun barrel, which FIRES into the roof- Gord SMASHES Berg on the head with his sidearm.
Gordon's men pull the pickup driver from his cab- Gordon  crouches down to the Lamborghini wreck to help pull Wayne from the car.  Gordon recognizes him as he pulls him free
You okay, Mr. Wayne?
Wayne looks at him, woozy.  Sits on the curb.
Call me Bruce.  I think so.
That was a brave thing, you did.
Trying to catch the light?
You weren't protecting the van?
Wayne turns- sees the police van as if for the first time Reese steps down, dazed.
Why?  Who's in it?
Reese locks eyes with Wayne.  Nods.  Gordon sizes up Bruc Wayne and his crushed sports car.
You don't watch a whole lot of news,  do you, Mr. Wayne?
(shrugs) It can get a little intense.  Think  I should go to hospital?
Not today, I wouldn't.
The Joker walks calmly through the mostly deserted buildi

As he walks he pulls a DETONATOR from his pocket.  Stroll along he PUSHES THE BUTTON... STAGGERED EXPLOSIONS BURST  INTO THE CORRIDOR BEHIND HIM LIKE DEMOLITION BLASTS... th Joker just walks out the door...
The Joker STROLLS down the steps- WINDOWS BLOW OUT IN SER People DIVE for cover- Engel PILES into a school bus- The Joker walks across the parking lot- THE BUILDING  COLLAPSING BEHIND HIM...
Gordon hears the EXPLOSION.
Gotham general... (grabs his phone) Did you get Dent out?
I think so-
The Cop cowers as DEBRIS and SMOKE BLAST across the stree
The Joker gets onto the bus.  Nods at his man at the whee
All eyes are on the collapsed building.  One school bus p out from the line of other buses.  Heads down the street.
An empty neighborhood dive, the local DRUNK passed out at the bar, BARTENDER, watching BREAKING NEWS on the TV.
Sweet Jesus.  D'you see this, Mike?   They blew up a hospital...
Detective Wuertz, at a booth looks up at the TV, bored.
Shouldn't you be out there, you know,  doing something?
It's my day off.
The Bartender shuts the register.
I gotta take a leak, keep an eye on  things, will ya?
The Bartender steps out.  The back door OPENS again.
What?  You need me to shake it for-
He TRAILS off as someone sticks a gun in his face: Harvey Dent.  Standing in shadow.  He sits.
Hello.
Dent, I thought you was...dead...
Dent leans into the light.  The left side of his face is  HIDEOUSLY BURNED, cheek gone, blackened teeth and gums.
Half.
Dent picks up Wuertz's drink.  Takes a SIP.  Wuertz watch the bare muscles RETRACT as Dent SWALLOWS.
Who picked up Rachel, Wuertz?
It must've been Maroni's men-
Dent SLAMS the glass back on the table- Wuertz FLINCHES.
You, of all people, are gonna protect  the other traitor in Gordon's unit?
I don't know- he'd never tell me. (stares at Dent) I swear to God, I didn't know what  they were gonna do to you-
Funny, I don't know what's going to  happen to you, either.
Dent pulls his coin from his pocket.  FLIPS it.  Wuertz  watches it SPIN.  It lands on the table.  Scarred side up The drunk at the bar STIRS at the GUNSHOT.
Gordon, manic, surveys the scene with a Cop-
You must know how many were inside- you've got patient lists, roll calls-

Sir!  Sir.  Take a look at what we're  dealing with.  Cops, National Guard- (gestures at buses) We're showing 50 missing- but that  building was clear.  These buses are  heading off to other hospitals- my  guess is we missed one.
Yeah?  What's your guess about where  Harvey Dent is?
The cop says nothing.
Keep looking.  Keep it to yourself.
Fox is watching the news.  His intercom buzzes.
Mr. Fox?  Security is showing a break- in at the R and D department.
Fox watches two security men force the door.  He enters a

Fox enters the dimly-lit room.  At one end is an extraord array of thousands of tiny monitors.  Fox approaches,  fascinated, as they quietly display architectural pattern individually and in concert.  The images become a MAP.
Beautiful.  Isn't it?
Fox nods, staring at the monitors as Batman approaches.
Beautiful.  Unethical.  Dangerous.   You've turned every phone in the  city into a microphone...
Lucius presses a key.  The BABBLE of a MILLION CONVERSATI at once fills the room.  Every cell phone in the city.
And high frequency generator/receiver.

Like the phone I gave you in Hong  Kong.  You took my sonar concept and  applied it to everybody's phone in  the City.  With half the city feeding  you sonar you can image all of Gotham. (turns to Batman) This is wrong.
I've got to find this man, Lucius.
But at what cost?
The database is null-key encrypted.   It can only be accessed by one person.
No one should have that kind of power.
That's why I gave it to you.  Only  you can use it.
Lucius looks at Batman.  Hard.
Spying on thirty million people wasn't  in my job description.
Batman points to a TV screen.  Fox turns.  ON SCREEN: the Joker shakes his head above a graphic "LATEST THREAT"...
What does it take to make you people  want to join in..?
Gordon watches a screen.  Grave.
You failed to kill the lawyer...  I've got to get you off the bench  and into the game.  So, here it is...
The bar, packed with business people watches the TV.  SIL
Come nightfall, this city is mine,  and anyone left here plays by my  rules.  If you don't want to be in  the game, get out now.
Bar patrons start moving... The Joker reaches for the cam
But the bridge-and-tunnel crowd are  in for a surprise.
CUT TO STATIC.  The bar patrons look around, confused.
Fox turns from the TV to look at Batman.
Trust me.
Fox stares at Batman.
This is the audio sample.
He plugs a USB dongle into the console.  A sample of the  Joker's voice from the call-in news program plays.
If he talks within range of any phone  in the city, you'll be able to  triangulate his position.
Lucius toggles a menu.  The city is an open book- People  working, eating, sleeping.  Lucius shakes his head.
When you've finished, type your name  to switch it off.
I'll help you this one time...
Lucius sits at the console.  Batman moves off-
But consider this my resignation.
Batman turns.  Fox looks at him, serious.
As long as this machine is at Wayne  Industries, I won't be.
Gothamites POUR out of the city, on foot and by car... th BRIDGES and TUNNELS are deserted, but for BOMB SQUAD sear teams.
Gordon briefs the Mayor.
My officers are going over every  inch of the tunnels and bridges, but  with the Joker's threat they're not  and option.
Land routes East?
Backed up for hours.  Which leaves  the ferries with thirty thousand  waiting to board.  Plus, corrections  are at capacity, so I want to use a  ferry to take some prisoners off the  island.
The men you and Dent put away?  Those  aren't people I'm worried about.

You should be- they're the people  you least want to be stuck with in  an emergency.  Whatever the Joker's  planning, it's a good bet that  Harvey's prisoners might be involved.   I want 'em out of here.

At the ferry terminal, National Guardsman watch over the  THIRTY THOUSAND jostling, scared people waiting to board two MASSIVE FERRIES to Seven Sisters.  Grumbles turn to Y as 800 PRISONERS are loaded onto a ferry by shotgun-totin CORRECTIONS OFFICERS.
That ain't right!  We should be on  that boat.
You want to ride across with them,  be my guest.
Maroni climbs into the back of a limo.
Maroni settles back into his seat.  The car pulls away.
Don't stop for lights, cops, nothing.
Going to join your wife?
Maroni STARTS.  Someone is in here with him.  Harvey Dent Two Face- leans forward, clutching a pistol.
You love her?
Yes.
Can you imagine what it would be  like to listen to her die?
Take it up with the Joker.  He killed  your woman.  Made you... like this...
The Joker's just a mad dog.  I want  whoever let him off the leash.
Maroni looks at Dent.  Worried.
I took care of Wuertz, but who was  your other man inside Gordon's unit? Who picked up Rachel?  It must've  been someone she trusted.
If I tell you, will you let me go?
It can't hurt your chances.
It was Ramirez.
Pulls out his coin.  Dent cocks the pistol...
But you said-
I said it couldn't hurt your chances.
Dent FLIPS it.  Looks: good side.  He shrugs.
Lucky guy.
Maroni looks confused.  Dent FLIPS the coin again.  Looks down at the coin.  Shakes his head.
But he's not.
Who?
Dent smiles.  PUTS HIS SEAT BELT ON.
Your driver.
Dent presses the barrel of the revolver behind the shadow the driver.  Maroni LUNGES, SCREAMING.  Dent FIRES.
The Limo SWERVES off of the bridge, SOARS out over the ca and PANCAKES into the RETAINING WALL.

CIVILIANS CRAM their way onto one ferry.  Finally, the  COMMANDER of the National Guard unit SIGNALS to his men t STOP BOARDING and CAST OFF. The two FERRIES set off across the river, heading for the lights of the distant shore of the mainland.
The FIRST MATE looks out the window, at the second ferry. It is DEAD in the WATER.  He turns to the PILOT [PRISON  FERRY].
They've lost their engines.
Get on the radio and tell 'em we'll  come back for them once we dump these Scumbags-
Suddenly, the control panel FLICKERS and DIES.
Get down to the engine room.
The First Mate skirts around the PRISONERS and CORRECTION OFFICERS...
The First Mate opens the door to the engine room.  STOPS. HUNDREDS OF BARRELS OF DIESEL FUEL.  And a small, wrapped PRESENT, topped with a BOW.
The Pilot [Prison Ferry] is holding the small present.  H radio CRACKLES.
Same thing over here- enough diesel  to blow us sky high.  And a present.
Batman sits on the bat-pod, cape blowing.  Listening.
Fox?  There's something going on on  the ferries...
As cold scared Families watch, the NATIONAL GUARD COMMAND UNWRAPS that ferry's present.  Inside, he finds a crude R DETONATOR.
Why would they give us the detonator  to our own bomb?
Up in the wiring at the ceiling, a CELL PHONE taped in to the P.A. rings and answers.
Tonight, you're all going to be part  of a social experiment.

head_text.subj: GUARDSMEN ALL LISTEN AS THE JOKER'S VOICE RINGS OUT.

text: Lucius Fox looks up as the console CHIMES.
I'm zeroing in.
Through the magic of diesel fuel and  ammonium nitrate, I'm ready right  now to blow you all sky high.  Anyone  attempts to get off their boat, you  all die...
His voice is on the ferry, but that's  not the source...
Batman looks out, across the entire city skyline.
Do you have a location on the Joker?
It's west...
Batman FIRES UP the bat-pod- his cape SHRINKS into its pa form as he PEELS OUT, ROARING into the night.
But we're going to make things a  little more interesting than that.  Tonight, we're going to learn a little  bit about ourselves...
Barbara Gordon answers the phone.
Barbara, it's Anna Ramirez-
Hi, Anna-
Listen carefully, there's no time.  Jim needs you to pack up and get the  kids in the car right away.
But the units outside-
Barbara, those cops can't be trusted. Jim needs you away from them as soon  as possible.  I'll call them off for 10 minutes, you'll have to move fast-
But where-
I'm going to give you an address-  Jim will meet you there...
Ramirez is holding the phone.
250, 52nd street.  Leave as soon as  the patrol car pulls out.
Dent is holding a gun at Ramirez's head.  She hangs up.
She believe you?
Ramirez nods.
She trusts you.  Just like Rachel  did.
I didn't know-
'What they were gonna do'?  You're  the second cop to say that to me.   What, exactly, did you think they  were going to do?
I'm sorry- they got me early on.  My  mother's medical bills and my-
Don't!
Dent FLIPS his coin.
I took a little from them- once  they've got you, they keep you.  I'm  sorry.
Dent looks at his coin.  Good side.
Live to fight another day, officer.
Dent CRACKS her on the head with his gun.
The Pilot [Prison Ferry] tries the radio.  It's DEAD.
He killed the radio.
There's no need for all of you to  die.  That would be a waste.  So  I've left you both a little present.
The Joker stares out over the harbor, at the ferries.  Ta into a cell phone.  Holding a detonator, with TWO BUTTONS
Each of you has a remote to blow up  the other boat.
The Prisoners and Corrections Officers listen.  Appalled.

At midnight, I blow you all up.  If,  however, one of you presses the  button, I'll let that boat live.   You Choose.  So who's it going to be- Harvey Dent's most wanted scumbag  collection... or the sweet innocent  civilians?   (beat) Oh, and you might want to decide  quickly, because the people on the  other boat may not be quite so noble.

The Joker HANGS UP.  The Pilot [Prisoner Ferry] looks dow at the remote in his hands.  Prisoners begin YELLING and  PUSHING.  The WARDEN takes the remote from the Pilot- COC his shotgun.  His men level their weapons at the crowd.
Gordon looks out at the ferries.  His phone rings.
Have the Joker's location-
Batman ROARS along on the bat-pod.
Prewitt building.  Assemble on the  building opposite.
The National Guard Commander is holding the remote.  Seve passengers take a step towards him.  He PULLS his weapon.
Stay back.
A BUSINESSMAN clutching his briefcase speaks up.
Who are you to decide?  We ought to  talk it over, at least.
Other passengers agree.  A MOTHER with two KIDS speaks up
We don't all have to die.  Why should  my babies die?  Those men had their  chance-
We're not talking about this...
They're talking over the same exact  thing on the other boat.
If they're even bothering to talk.   Let's put it to a vote.
As the Prisoners grow angrier, a CORRECTIONS OFFICER FIRE his shotgun into the air.  The Prisoners back off.  Sligh

A GUARDSMAN on this boat passes around a hat.  People dro CHITS into it.  Passengers filling out chits eye each oth People on their phones say goodbye to loved ones. The Pilot [Passenger Ferry] looks out across the water to the other Ferry.  Looks up at the clock.  Ten to midnight STARES down at his blank chit.
Gordon and his SWAT team leaders set up SNIPER and SCOPE  positions on the balustrade.
A SWAT stands beside the empty school bus.
We've found our missing bus.
Gordon looks at the SWAT LEADER.
Then we have a hostage situation.
They look across at the large windows of the Prewitt Buil The Joker's men, in crude, homemade CLOWN MASKS are clear visible, automatic weapons in hand.
I got hostages!
They look through his scope.  Crouched deeper in the room PATIENTS, DOCTORS, and NURSES, huddled.
It's a shooting gallery.  Why'd he  choose a spot with such big windows?
He likes the view.
Batman gestures towards the view of the ferries.
We have clear shots on five clowns.
Snipers take them out, smash the  windows- a team rappels in, a team  moves in by the stairwells.  2 or 3  or three casualties, max.
(barely hesitates) Let's do it.
It's not that simple.  With the Joker,  it never is.
What's simple, is that every second  we don't take him, those people on  the ferries get closer to blowing  each other up!
That won't happen.
Then he'll blow them both up!  There's  no time- we have to go in now-
There's always a catch with him-
That's why we can't wait- we can't  play his games-
Batman turns.
I need five minutes.  Alone-
No.  There's no time.  We have clear  shots.
Gordon pulls his gun.  Batman turns back.  The SWATS watc
Dent's in there with them.  We have  to save Dent!  I have to save Dent! (to SWAT Leader) Get ready-
Batman LEAPS from the building, OPENS his cape- SOARS acr the gulf between the two buildings- Gordon puts his weapo away.  Curses softly.  Turns to the SWAT leader.
Two minutes.  Then you breach.
Batman LANDS against the glass two floors below-
Fox.  I need picture.
Fox hits some keys-
You've got POV. on alpha channel,  omni on beta-

SMOKED GLASS EYEPIECES slip down over Batman's eye holes. Batman's SONAR POV.: the layers of the building dissolve, levels of TRANSPARENCY PULSING rhythmically... Batman can see the people inside the building...
The Joker is standing by the window, looking out at his  handiwork.  The Chechen's DOGS start BARKING.  He SMILES.
Batman reaches into his utility belt, SPRAYS PLASTIC onto the glass- lets it harden- PUNCHES the window-which BREAK QUIETLY as the pieces stick to the laminate- he slips ins
Batman's eyes glow white as he uses his sonar to look THR the corner: AN ARMED CLOWN IS LEANING AGAINST THE CORNER.
A six man SWAT team prepares to rappel from the roof.
A SWAT team moves up the stairs.
Gordon's phone rings.
Hello?  Barbara, calm down-
Hello, Jim.
Harvey?  What the hell's going on?
You're about to know what my suffering  is really like...
Gordon looks across at the Prewitt penthouse...
Where are you?  Where's my family?!
Where my family died.
Click.  Gordon looks at the SWAT leader.  Pale.
Red Team.  Go!
Gordon moves to the door off the roof.

Batman GRABS the Armed Clown, drops him, silently.  He go to disarm him- THE WEAPON IS DUCT-TAPED TO THE CLOWN'S HA Batman RIPS off the clown mask: STARING, FRIGHTENED EYES- MOUTH DUCT-TAPED SHUT... it's E Batman looks up: Four more clowns line the windows, weapo duct-taped to their hands.  On SONAR: he looks into where the hostages are crouched... the "PATIENTS" and "DOCTORS" are carrying weapons- these are the Joker's men... Above  them SWATS RAPPEL FROM THE ROOFTOP.  In the stairwells, t more teams prepping.
Don't.  Move.
Engel nods, terrified.
The SWATS line up the clowns in their sights...
The SWAT team arrives at the penthouse fire exit.  They s CHARGES across the inner wall-
The SWAT Leader checks his watch.
Go!  Go!  Go!
A SWAT Sniper zeroes in on a clown- the clown DISAPPEARS- the Sniper looks up, confused-
Batman yanks the clown along the floor using his grapple the clown takes down the two next to him- Batman leaps fo the nearest two as SHOTS SHATTER the glass-
The SWATS rappel down the building- SWING in through the  broken windows-

The "hostages" reel from the BLAST- The SWATS SWOOP in, a weapons at the clowns, throwing PERCUSSION GRENADES- Batm takes out the SWATS with fists and BATARANGS- The last SW aims at BATMAN- behind him a "DOCTOR" raises a shotgun... behind the "Doctor" Batman can see through the wall at SW preparing to breach... Batman VAULTS over the SWAT into a two-foot kick into the "Doctor's" chest-

The Swats BLAST OUT THE WALL- the team leader steps up to the hole... the BAT-GRAPPLE FIRES out-lodging in his kevl vest... he is YANKED, SCREAMING, through the door.  The r of his team look at each other.  Steel themselves.  Move through the hole...

As the SWATS race in they find Engel, terrified, next to pile of unconscious "hostages", and their team leader, on end of an absailing rope tied around his waist.  Batman i on them, weaving KICKING, PUNCHING, and, with one hand,  clipping carabinners looped to the absailing rope onto th webbing of vests. Batman steps back- picks up the team leader- SWAT weapons aim at him- he hurls the Team Leader out the window... th
SWATS watch him go... the rope pays out... one by one the are YANKED out of the window...

A SNIPER watches through his scope as the six man SWAT te soars out of the window and drops.  The line snaps taut a they hang, like a mountaineering team in crisis.  Batman, crouched in the broken window, secures the line.
What the hell's he doing?
Batman looks right at the sniper- Raises his grapple gun- BAM.  The bat grapple smashes into the Sniper's scope- th rifle is YANKED out of his hands.
Batman races past a dazed Engel...
(pathetic) Thanks.
...into the main office.  The Joker is there.
You came.  I'm touched.
Where's the detonator?
The Dogs LEAP at Batman- SMASH him to the ground...
The Pilot [Passenger Ferry] finishes counting the votes. Reads the verdict.
The tally is 196 votes against. (looks down) And 340 votes for.
The passengers avoid eye contact with each other.
The Corrections Officers are in a phalanx in the corner,  facing off against hundreds of menacing Prisoners.
Do you wanna die!
The Warden and his men look at each other.  At the clock.

Batman WRESTLES with the Rotweilers- a blinding mass of  Batman, black fur and bared teeth- The Joker POPS a switchblade.  Moves in to the mass- Batm KICKS OFF the last of the dogs- the Joker JABS his knife  into Batman's RIBS-
All the old familiar places.
Batman recoils in pain.  The Joker BUTTS him- KNEES him- ENERGY explodes from his lean frame- he KICKS the injured Batman back towards the glass...
The Pilot [Passenger Ferry] looks at the remote in his ha
I voted for it.  Same as most of  you.  Doesn't seem right that we  should all die...
Someone calls out from the back.
So do it!
I didn't say I'd do it.  Don't forget.   We're still here.  Which means they  haven't killed us, yet, either.
He sets the remote down on a bench in the front of the lo The other passengers and guardsmen stare at it...
A HUGE, TATTOOED PRISONER pushes his way to the front.  H walks towards the Warden, who is sweating, looking at the remote.
You don't wanna die.  But you don't  know how to take a life.  Give it to  me.
The Warden looks at the remote.  At the clock.
These men will kill you and take it,  anyway.  Give it to me, you can tell  people I took it by force... give it  to me and I'll do what you should  have done ten minutes ago.
Everyone stares at the remote.  One minute left.  The  Businessman stands.  Walks over and picks it up.
No one wants to get their hands dirty.   Fine.  I'll do it.  Those men on  that boat made their choices.  They  chose to murder and steal.  It makes  no sense for us to die, too.
He looks at the other passengers.  No one makes eye conta
The Warden slowly hands him the REMOTE.  The Prisoner loo at it.  He looks the Warden in the eye... Then TOSSES the remote out the window. Warden, prisoners and officers are stunned.

Batman FLIES backwards THROUGH THE WINDOW- glass flying- Joker KICKS out a wooden brace holding up the STEEL FRAME Batman's arms fly up as it comes crashing down onto his n saved by his protective gauntlets.  Batman GRUNTS as the  Joker STEPS onto the steel beam...
If we don't stop fighting, we're  going to miss the fireworks.
There won't be any fireworks.
Batman STRUGGLES to keep the beam from CRUSHING his neck.
The Businessman stares at the remote in his hands.  Final he puts it down.  Sits down.  Waits to die. The clock strikes MIDNIGHT.
Batman indicates the clock... twelve o'clock.
What were you hoping to prove?  That  deep down, we're all as ugly as you?
The Joker looks at the clock...
The Passengers brace.  Look at the clock.  Confused...
The smile disappears from the Joker's face.
You're alone.
The Joker CROUCHES down, hovering above Batman's face and arms.  Shows him the remote.
Can't rely on anyone these days.
The Joker ARMS the remote...
Have to do everything yourself.  I  always have- and it's not always  easy... (smiles, remembering) You know how I got these scars?
Batman looks up at him.
No.  But I know how you get these-

Batman's SCALLOP BLADES FIRE OUT OF HIS GAUNTLET, nailing the Joker in the chest and arm- he STAGGERS back- Batman, freed, leaps forward- KICKS HIM OVER THE EDGE- GRABS the  remote- The Joker GIGGLES as he FALLS, enjoying the ride.  Someth SLAMS into his leg, and he JERKS to a stop- BATMAN'S GRAP The Joker HOLLERS in pain as Batman HAULS him up.
Just couldn't let me go, could you?
I guess this is what happens when an  unstoppable force meets an immovable  object.  You truly are incorruptible,  aren't you?
Batman secures the Joker UPSIDE DOWN.  The Joker is LAUGH
You won't kill me out of some  misplaced sense of self- righteousness... and I won't kill  you because you're too much fun.   We're going to do this forever.
You'll be in a padded cell, forever.
Maybe we can share it.  They'll need  to double up, the rate this city's  inhabitants are losing their minds...
This city just showed you it's full  of people ready to believe in good.
The Joker looks up at him.  A twinkle in his eye.

Till their spirit breaks completely.   Until they find out what I did with  the best of them.  Until they get a  good look at the real Harvey Dent,  and all the heroic things he's done. (indicates ferry) Then those criminals will be straight  back onto the streets and Gotham  will understand the true nature of  heroism. (off look) You didn't think I'd risk losing the  battle for the soul of Gotham in a  fist fight with you?  You've got to  have an ace in the hole.  Mine's  Harvey.
Batman hauls the Joker up, nose to nose.
What did you do?
I took Gotham's white knight.
And I brought him down to my level.   It wasn't hard- madness is like  gravity.  All it takes is a little  push.
Joker laughs.  Batman leaves him to the SWATS.
Lucius.  Find Harvey Dent.
Gordon gets out of his car, gun drawn.  Makes his way int the blackened wreck of a building...
Gordon peers into the darkness.
Dent?
No reply.  Gordon makes his way deeper.  Up the stairs.

Gordon spots Barbara and their two children huddled toget He moves towards them- Barbara is shaking her head- WHAM!  Dent cracks Gordon over the head with his gun.  De disarms Gordon, rolls him over.  He turns to look at the  ENORMOUS hole in the floor.  From this side, in the moonl Dent looks completely normal.
This is where they brought her,  Gordon.  After your people handed  her over.  This is where they bound  her.  This is where she suffered.   This is where she died.
I know.  I was here.  Trying to save  her.
Dent TURNS, revealing his dark side.
But you didn't, did you?
I couldn't.
Yes, you could.
If you'd listened to me- if you'd  stood up against corruption instead  of doing your deal with the devil.
I was trying to fight the mob-
Dent MOVES towards Gordon.

You wouldn't dare try to justify  yourself if you knew what I'd lost.   Have you ever had to talk to the  person you love most, wondering if  you're about to listen to them die?   You ever had to lie to that person?   Tell them it's going to be all right,  when you know it's not?  Well, you're  about to find out what that feels  like.  Then you'll be able to look  me in the eye and tell me you're  sorry.
Dent turns- steps over to Barbara- puts the gun to her te
Harvey.  Put the gun down.  You're  not going to hurt my family.
No, just the person you need most. (cocks gun) So is it your wife?
Put the gun down.
Dent moves the gun to point at Gordon's little girl.
Please, Harvey...
Dent moves to James Gordon.  Brushes the hair out of the  boy's eyes with the muzzle.  Gordon SNAPS.
Goddamit.  Stop pointing that gun at  my family, Dent.
We have a winner.
Dent pulls the boy away from his mother.
No!  Jim stop him!  Don't let him!
Dent walks James past Gordon to the edge of the burnt flo He touches the raw wood at the edge of the floor.
I'm sorry, Harvey.  For everything.   But, please.  Please don't hurt him.
Cop cars descend on the warehouse.
Dent looks at Gordon, FURIOUS.
You brought your cops?
All they know is there's a situation.   They don't know who, or what.  They're  just creating a perimeter.
You think I want to escape?!  There's No escape from this-
Dent indicates his face.  His suffering.
No one needs to escape, because no  one's done anything wrong.  And nobody  has to.
Dent chuckles.  A macabre sight.
I've done plenty wrong, Gordon.   Just not quite enough.  Yet.
Dent squeezes the gun a little tighter against the little boy's neck.  The boy WHIMPERS.
You don't want to hurt the boy, Dent.
Dent turns.  Batman steps from the shadows.

It's not about what I want.  It's  about what's fair. (to Gordon and Batman) You thought we could be decent men  in an indecent world.  You thought  we could lead by example.  You thought  the rules could be bent but not  break... you were wrong.  The world  is cruel. (shows his coin) And the only morality in a cruel  world is chance.  Unbiased.   Unprejudiced.  Fair.
Nothing fair ever came out of the  barrel of a gun, Dent.
(shows the coin) His boy's got the same chance she  had.  Fifty-fifty.
Batman steps closer, desperate, trying to reach Dent.
What happened to Rachel wasn't chance.   We decided to act.  We three.  We  knew the risks and we acted as one.   We are all responsible for the  consequences.
Dent looks at Batman.  Pleading.
Then why was it only me who lost  everything?
Batman looks into Dent's eyes.  Emotional.
It wasn't.
(furious) The Joker chose me!
Because you were the best of us.  He  wanted to prove that even someone as  good as you could fall.
(bitter) And he was right.

But you're fooling yourself if you  think you're letting chance decide.   You're the one pointing the gun,  Harvey.  So point it at the people  who were responsible.  We all acted  as one.  Gordon.  Me.  And you.
Dent is listening, the wheels in his deranged mind turnin
Fair enough.
Dent eases his grip on the boy.
You first.
He points the gun at Batman.  FLIPS the coin.  TAILS.  He SHOOTS.  Batman COLLAPSES to the ground, clutching his gu
My turn.
He points the gun at his own head.  FLIPS the coin.  HEAD He looks a little disappointed. Finally, he points the gun back at Gordon's son.
Your turn, Gordon.
You're right, Harvey.  Rachel's death Was my fault.  But punish me-
I'm about to.  Tell your son it's  going to be all right, Gordon.  Lie.   Like I lied.
Gordon looks up.  Pained.  Locks eyes with his son.
It's going to be all right, son.
Dent FLIPS the coin.  High.  Dent's eyes FOLLOW the coin Batman HURLS himself at Dent and the boy.

All three of them VANISH over the edge.  A TERRIBLE CRASH then silence, but for the sound of DENT'S COIN, SPINNING the floor at the edge of the hole. Gordon, horrified, RUNS to the edge- peers down- Dent lie at the bottom of the hole, his neck broken.  DEAD. The coin stops spinning, GOOD SIDE UP. Gordon's son swings into view, HANGING from Batman, who i holding onto a JOIST with all his strength... Gordon reaches down to GRAB his son- HAULS him up... Batman FALLS..., dropping and dropping, SMASHING THROUGH  protruding WOOD and PIPES... He lands HARD near Dent.
The cops prepare to STORM the front door.
Gordon races down the stairs.  Rushes over to Batman.
Dad, is he okay?
Gordon crouches at Batman's side.  The Batman GRASPS Gord arm.  STAGGERS to his feet.
Thank-you.
You don't have to-
Yes, I do.
Gordon and Batman stare down at Dent's body.  Grave.
The Joker won.
Gordon stares down at SCARRED SIDE of Harvey Dent.

Harvey's prosecution, everything he  fought for, everything Rachel died  for.  Undone.  Whatever chance Gotham  had of fixing itself... whatever  chance you gave us of fixing our  city... dies with Harvey's reputation.
We bet it all on him.  The Joker  took the best of us and tore him  down.  People will lose all hope.
No.  They won't. (looks at Gordon) They can never know what he did.
(incredulous) Five dead?  Two of them cops?  We  can't sweep that under-
No.  But the Joker cannot win.
Batman crouches to Dent's body.
Gotham needs its true hero.
Gently, he turns Dent's head so the good side of his face up.  Gordon looks from Dent's face to Batman.  Understand
You?  You can't-
Yes, I can.
Batman stands.  Faces Gordon.
You either die a hero or live long  enough to see yourself become the  villain.  I can do those things  because I'm not a hero, like Dent.   I killed those people.  That's what  I can be.
(angry) No, you can't!  You're not!
Batman hands Gordon his police radio.
I'm whatever Gotham needs me to be.

head_text.subj: BEHIND HIM IS A LARGE PHOTOGRAPH OF DENT SMILING.

text: ...a hero.  Not the hero we deserved-  the hero we needed.  Nothing less  than a knight.  Shining...
They'll hunt you.
You'll hunt me.

head_text.subj: HAND, WATCHED BY AN ASSORTMENT OF COPS AND REPORTERS...

text: You'll condemn me, set the dogs on  me...

head_text.subj: GORDON TAKES THE AXE TO THE BAT SYMBOL- SPARKING, SMASHIN

text: ...because it's what needs to happen.
Because sometimes the truth isn't  good enough...
...sometimes, people deserve more.

head_text.subj: DESTRUCT WARNINGS". THEN DIES. FOX SMILES TO HIMSELF.

text: Batman hurries off.  LIMPING into the shadows.
Batman?!
James RUNS down the stairs to join father-
Why's he running, Dad?!
Gordon stares after Batman.
Because we have to chase him...
As Cops race into the buildings the DOGS get the scent an pull away from the doorway, following the SHADOW into the stacks of shipping containers...
James looks at his father, confused.
He didn't do anything wrong!
Gordon stares after the Batman.  The sound of the dogs  becoming louder and more ferocious.
Why, dad?  Why?!
Because...
The Batman LURCHES between shipping containers.  STUMBLIN BLEEDING.  He makes it to the bat-pod...
...he's the hero Gotham deserves...  but not the one it needs right now.  So we'll hunt him, because he can  take it.  Because he's not our hero...
The bat-pod streaks through Gotham's underground streets, the Batman's cape fluttering behind.  A wraith...
...he's a silent guardian, a watchful  protector... a dark knight.
The Batman races up a ramp into a blinding light- CUT TO BLACK. CREDITS. END.
